With this review I want to show some negatives of Mafia: Definitive edition and why I wouldnt really recommend it.If we were looking at Mafia as its own thing, the game would be good. But the issue is that it isnt its own thing. There is competition that does much better for the similar price tag.I bought this game because of its "open world" tag, thinking that it would be similar to gta 5, but in a different setting. Of course I was hoping for the game to have its own unique spin on the open world genre, but what happend really disappointed me. (Just a heads up; this review will have some comparisons between gta 5 and mafia)The game IS open world, but you cant do a whole lot with this world. Instead of having a open world game with a story, this is a story set in the open world, meaning that instead of having a lot to do in the open world, the only thing you actually do is missions. But those arent the main issues I have with the game. In a single mission I encountered TWO bugs, not even 30 minutes into the playthrough. For those wondering, its the second chapter. The game instructs me to sprint, and I see the valley that I decide to run towards. Only to be blocked by some magical wall (??) causing me to lose the mission. No big deal, I restart from last checkpoint and manage to run through the valley. Now Im told to vault over the fence. I do it. I continue to run and now I have to vault onto some crates (??) and now I fall through the world and die.... That all happend in the span of couple of minutes. Right there and then I though of quitting the game, but part of me tought that the odds of this happening are low so I kept on playing.The driving camera feels odd to say the least. The gun gameplay feels ok, but it lacks that oomph. In gta for example the whole screen greys out and zooms in for a short period while showing the little x, which feels awesome. The controls for anything that isnt gun related are weird though.... Why cant I press m1 to smack someone with the bat? Instead I have to spam q for whatever reason.And finally the language. I really love when a character in 1930s says "stop bustin my balls". The game isnt bad and I can see why the game has so many positive reviews, but it isnt my cup of tea. I dont think its worth 40‚Ç?especially when gta 5 which costs 50% more offers MUCH more. Not to mention that gta 5 often goes on sale meaning you can get it for even less than 60‚Ç? I would recommend buying this game only if its on sale, and only then.
10/10 Would play again
10/10 would play again

This game is amazing, however there are a couple of problems I have with it. Overall the game is fun, you can spend a whole day without getting bored because this game is just so much fun. The things I like Ok first lets start with the good parts. Firstly you can play any nation which existed at that time, and even if it didn't, you can tag the country which owned it at that time, and chances are, you can release that nation. Also the default focus tree is amazing. While it doesn't provide anything historicaly related with that nation, it provides the nation with a couple of military factories, civilian factories, infastructure, option to quickly change the ideology, option to develop your airforce and navy, and to get a couple of research bonuses. Also if you have waking the tiger dlc, almost every nation gets the option to form the nation at which they were the biggest (ie. Iran can form the Persian Empire). Also even tough good portion of nations don't have the custom focus tree, by every dlc, new focus trees for nations get added, and old custom focus trees which have some flaws get reworked. What I really like is how you can pick many alternative routes. Wanna go trotskiyist soviet union? No problem. Want to make america communist while you play fascist britain? No problem, just pick in game rules for america to go communist route or go non historical. One thing I also really like is the achievements. Some of them sound funny, but the reason I love them is because how hard some of them are, and it makes you feel amazing when you get them, and sort of it tells other how good you are. I also love things such as resistance which make hoi4 realistic, however there are some problems which I will mention below with it. I love the research system and I love how you can't research everything instantly, making you decide what do you want. Do you want a strong army and airforce or strong navy and airforce or strong army and navy? It is up to you to decide. While it is restricting, for people searching for a challenge it makes it more fun, and in multiplayer games it makes it more balanced and it requires more teaming. And finally, the thing I absolutely adore is how easy it is to get the mods and how many mods there are, which can variate form a small colour change, to a change in whole timeline or era. Also the music is amazing, most of them are relaxing. Those are all the things I like about hoi4, now it's time to talk about couple of problems.  The things I don't like One thing I don't like about hoi4 are the Soviets. They aren't hard or realistic. Germany can without a strugle DESTROY the Soviets. While The Great Purge debuff is amazing, there are really small buffs later on, which doesn't presure Germany into declaring the war in 1941. or earlier. The only strong thing about the Soviets are their manpower and the Stalin line. As soon as you go trough the Stalin line, the game for the Soviets is pretty much over. Other thing which makes me dislike hoi4 a bit is the power of airforce. It is too powerful. You can literally make 1000 planes and make them kamikaze strike english channel or make them naval bomb and you DESTROY the royal navy. And while there are ways to counter that, it takes a giant effort to get rid of this problem if you don't have a good airforce. Now I already mentioned how I don't like something about resistance. That something is that you don't get that people uprise against you, the worst thing that can happen to you if you don't take care about resistance is to lose factories in that region. The last thing I don't like is about a dlc.  Death or dishonor  . You can buy it if you want or not, and that is why I won't complain how little it changes, but the things I don't like is that Yugoslavia doesn't have partizan uprizing.Those were all the things I liked and hated about hoi4. Of course I absolutely love this game, but it wouldn't be a proper review if I didn't include some minor things which sometimes irritate me.  DLCs  Together for Victory A really amazing dlc, adds a better puppet managment and focus trees for the british colonies and a better focus tree + Britain itself. Overall it is really amazing and you get a good protion for its price Death or Dishonor This dlc adds the least content and actually just adds focus trees for Yugoslavia, Romania and Hungary. The price is questionable, if you come from any of these countries I guess that it is worth it??? Waking the Tiger This dlc is worth its price. It reworks chinese overlords focus trees, and Japan. Also adds the option to form nations like I mentioned in the "the things I like" section. It also adds the better unit managment (force attack, last stand....). Personaly one of my favourite dlcs. Man the Guns The most recent dlc which adds most stuff into it. Personaly I like some things, and some I don't (like USA being op af with infinite oil) but overall I like it. I did read some reviews and some don't like it, some do so yeah, in the end it is up to you weather or not you want to buy a certain dlc or not. Conclusion I would of course give this game 10/10There are a lot of things you can do in hoi4, and whenever a new dlc comes out, pretty much the whole meta changes because of how much stuff they add, and that is what I love. Dlc are also amazing and if you really love this game and want to buy them, you should.

Amazing game, has great story and even greater gameplay. I absolutely love this game. I love how this game doesn't just focus on land, but you must focus on navy too, and if you don't, then you're screwed. I also like how every troop has its own unique ability, which can either be used to make your unit stronger, making it vonerable for a shorter period of time, or just as a last chance for your unit to survive/defend your base. I love how mcv can go into water, which gives you a chance to actually survive if the enemy dominates the land. The plot is nice, and just like in ra it shows the corruption among the soviets. I recommend this game to everyone who loves strategy games, because it just offers so much. I also like the "research tree" and how it works. I love how I can get some special ability without building anything, and how I gain experiance over time.Now the part which I don't like. To me, naval gameplay feels forced, because it is in every mission, and good amount of missions you can't actually make vehnicles made for land only because at the start you are on the island. Exept that I don't have any other problems, and I know that this problem may be contradictory because I said how I love that you must build navy, which is true, but I don't like being forced to build my navy absolutely every mission I play.
Awful game, worst one I've ever played yet, reason why?You can't drive shopping carts ;(

This game is amazing, full of items and full of bosses. If you're a sandbox fan and you love challenging yourself, then this is the best game, which will complete those two requirements. Even tho many people at first think this game is like minecraft, it isn't, and btw stop thinking that any sandbox which looks blockish is a minecraft, because it isn't, and this game is a perfect example of it. At first, for beginers and people which have entered in hardmode, they may find this game overwelming, but once you complete this game first time, you will pretty much know the whole game. PRETTY MUCH. There are so many items, each run can be completed differently. Sometimes you may complete this game multiple times, and then later discover a new item. Even tho at first. since is a 2d game, players may think that that is a limitation in certain ways, but I can tell you now, devs have manished to completly remove that 2d limitation. Game is fun and full of items, just like mentioned before, but there are also biomes, from which every single biome has its respective mobs. Bosses are fun and exciting, and even tho you have to beat some bosses to progress (otherwise you can't complete the game), it doesn't really feel like it. You can summon the boss yourself, or randomly encounter it. Not every boss is a must fight. Almost every prehardmode boss can be bypasses, and you can instantly kill a boss which puts you into so called "hardmode". For those who are interested what hardmode is, it is just like a new start of the game, but harder, and no, that doesn't mean that your items get deleted or world, you keep the items, but there are more mobs and more biomes, and also most importantly, new bosses and items. For sandbox fans this will be amazing game, as they can explore, build, fight and craft. So I recommend you to buy this game, because you will have so much fun in it. Personaly I am not a big sandbox fan, I would much rather prefer fps or rts games, but this game has so much to offer, that I absolutly love it. Now the other part of the review, a bad part. Game is just like I said overwelming for new players or players which are first time in hardmode. When I was first time playing terraria I had terraria wiki open 24/7 to know how to craft stuff or how to obtain certain items, but again, like I said, once you complete terraria first time, you will know how to complete it second time. I recommend you to watch youtubers or streamers play it to learn a bit more and being on terraria wiki, and even try creating few worlds so that you find a perfect one for the first time, that way you wont have problems obtaining items required to defeat the bosses, that doesn't mean that you should get one item, then hop to your main world, make one more world, get items there and repeat this process, no. That means that you should make one world in which you will easily find items and caves, and make that your main world, and play ONLY on it with one character. Another problems is how long it takes to obtain certain items, lets say terra blade, since I am tired of explaining, just click  here [terraria.gamepedia.com]. And even tho it is true that is takes forever to obtain lets say, terra blade, they made it really rewarding. Now since I did defend bad sides you may say that I am being "fanboyish" towards terraria, and I will be honest, that may be true. But that is because I love this game, and I hope that many good updates will come out in the future. Terraria rating: 10/10Edit: Also to mention, in terraria forums, there are a LOT of mods you can have fun with once you have beaten the game, or even before, and community is really nice.

The game is outstanding, beautiful and I love it. That is my opinion in short, so if you have just wanted to know my opinion in short, here you go, now time for full explanation what do I like and what I don't like I like how in this cnc game we went from 2d technology to 3d technology, and it really gives this game some beautiful and stunning graphics. What I don't like is that you have removed almost every building and vehnicle and character from older cnc games, and yes I do understand that there weren't any vehnicles or characters or buildings from cnc 1 that could have been made by you (except if you used mods) in cnc 2, but cnc 2 had a lot of easter eggs which are reffering to cnc 1 + when you're battling against mutants, you see them use older vehnicles from cnc 1, and also in the last mission on gdi side, if you're quick enought, you can also get to use tanks from cnc 1, also there were a lot of missions where buildings from cnc 1 were in hidden places, but ok, lets get back to cnc 3. There weren't a lot of easter eggs, but what I do like is new side, scrin. It really explains some stuff about tiberium and its exsistance on planet earth. Another thing I am not big fan of is the effectivity of weapons. It just feels like that you have to make at least 20 vehnicles (from which 10 are at least anti soliders and other 10 anti buildings/vehnicles), while in older games you could just build one same vehnicle or troop 10-20 times and you would complete the mission, but I still like that you have to mix vehnicles and not just spam, lets say titans in cnc 2. I like the game it is really well made and I would recommend it to everyone. Also I like that you can turn buildings and turn your view. Sadly servers are now dead so I couldn't have had fun exploring techniques while meeting different people. This game is probably togheter with ra3 one of the last good remains of cnc franchise, since newest released cnc game, looks nothing like classic cnc games. Westwood had some really amazing and creative ideas for cnc 3, but since ea had them, their ideas didn't even mean something to ea, so they fired them, and you can really see that this game looks like half westwood product because there are some ideas which definently look like from cnc franchise and yet there are some thing in this game which don't look at all like older cnc games. And cnc 4 was just a proof that ea run of westwoods ideas.

The game is fun, exciting etc. The best part is how as a starter you can use op guns almost instantly and later on, those op guns become something weak, so you get better guns. Personaly I had around 10 guns and with every gun I had so much fun! Game offers so many things you can do, that you simply want to come back to the game again :D I am playing cs:go, but sometimes I just come back to the skill, that was also my first fps and that is why I love it! Also the sound effects are awesome! Headshot sound is epic in my opinion :) I also like how they allow you to exploit some of the guns (sniper rifles in this case) where you can quickly reload and then not even look at the scope (but you clicked the button for the scope) and then instantly shoots and I love how that makes your aim better :D Also every gun has something special about it (famas and a great damage, p90 and scope, awp and fast movement speed and good aim). The only thing I don't like is that every spray costs and that I can't work hard for it to get it, but I must spend the money to get it. Game is fun, and even tho it has some DLC's, it is not pay to win :D

Before I start saying anything good or bad abour cs:go I will instantly say, I love it. Game is fun, it isn't that one game with cool graphics and bad content, it has ok graphics which even low spec computers can handle  and still the game is really fun and really well known.However, even tho the game is great, like every game, even cs:go has some bad sides. First of all ranking system. Elo system may be precise and good in big ranks, but in silver it is unbalanced. You can see 3 players in your team having 15-17 kills and then 2 of your team mates with less than 10 kills. Second of all, competitive is too stresful. I am writing this by my own expiriance, and even tho some people are not stresed, I am one of those people which are stresed when they play cs:go.Now back to the good sides. Most of the weapons are balanced, and even tho terrorists have weapon advantage over ct's, ct's have advantage over points, they are controling them.In the conclusion, I love the game,  and I can't wait to see future updates of this game!

Reminds me a lot of Dungeon keeper series since it has the similar feature of "digging out" your own ant colony. It also reminds me of the Warcraft 3 map "Ant colony" which offers similar gameplay.  The game is entertaining and does have enough levels to justify the price in my opinion. However, I dislike that there is no way to obtain food in the "Formicarium" which lead to having to replay story levels to farm enough food to be able to finish the challenges (which must be beaten in order to continue the story missions). I feel as the development of the ant colony is a bit shallow as well, you just get some food storage and then start massing units. It would be nice with some additions like some sort of defense and research structures. It's also a shame that free play can't be played with friends. Overall it's a fun game and despite its shortcomings I would still recommend it.

Really cute and casual, fun to play with your partner (or friend)! It is quite short but it was an enjoyable experience. However, the puzzles are really basic and simple so don't get this game if you want to be challenged. If you are an achievement hunter this is perfect for you, 100% in less than 2 hours! Considering its price it's definitely worth the money!

I really wanted to like this game as it feels very nostalgic and similar to one of my favorite game series HoMM, but it just isn't enjoyable at all. The biggest issue is the lack of strategy, I feel no accomplishment at all after winning a battle. There's not really anything in the game that wants me to keep playing it.Here are some problems about the game:- Barely any description about units- Spell book is just a big mess and it's hard to understand which spell is valuable to use since description isn't that detailed and you can only cast a few spells before your mana runs out. - Not balanced at all between factions- Difficulty to control units during battle- In beginning of the game high level monsters are guarding resources which won't allow you to progress until you have some units, so basically you are stuck doing nothing- Battles are really boring and later into the game they take ages, the battle itself is just a big mess and you barely have much control over the battle, hence not much tactics can be used- Hero feels really useless, he runs in and dies immediately- AI turns takes quite long time to make their turns

Casual and enjoyable, however very short for its price (just like part 1). Not really anything new from part 1 (probably since it's simply part 2). I recommend getting it when it's on sale. Like the other games in the series, "easy" 100% achievement. Looking forward for the 4th game of the series which will hopefully bring something new to the table.

Despite the game being in development for a long time and considering the updates sure do take their time, I still recommend this game. Why? Well, because they didn't abandon the game (yet) and I think I bought this game 2013 which is a rather long time ago, but I would dare to say the game has come quite far since I first played it. Still in its current state there is enough content to entertain you for quite some time. I had a blast playing this with my siblings on split screen! The game can be very punishing and difficult, luckily there are many customizable options regarding game settings which can adjust the games realism/difficulty to the players liking. Personally I enjoy hordes of slow stupid zombies, but for someone who is looking for adrenaline, why not make them running demons with supermans hearing and strength? I would say for 13.99‚Ç?this surely is a steal, if you aren't convinced yet then you should check out the workshop. There are tons of mods which can enhance the game quite a lot! More items, new maps and other quality of life mods! And why not attempt at making your own mods as well? Worst case scenario, there is a "Request Refund" button, but most likely you wouldn't need to use this one ;)

Didn't really notice that much difference from the original releases (some visual upgrades only), I really wished they would have done something about the population cap which is one of the main issues with this game. It's worth getting this on a sale, but not for its full price. The DLC is the only "real" addition for this game, always fun with a new civilization! (But of course for $$$). Nonetheless another blast from the past!

Surprisingly a good remake, one of the best additions in this remake is the automatic farming on/off as it was very tedious to spam farms in the mill in the original game, until this day I still have nightmares about the exhausted farm sound... However, since it features new graphics some may still prefer the original. Nonetheless, a great remake! For me the original will always have a place in my heart, hence it shall not gather enough dust to be forgotten. In a later update they have also added Co-op for campaign, while I haven't really been interested in the singleplayer campaign it was a lot more fun to play with a friend. (Note, not all campaigns are available in co-op yet)

A real nostalgic gem, I would say though, a little overpriced for what it is (considering it's around 21-22 years old). The DLCs add some more civilizations, campaigns and maps (for some $$$). Nonetheless, a game that will keep you busy for tons of hours! Most importantly, there is still wololo in the game. I suggest looking into the definitive edition as well for improvements such as toggle on/off automatic farming (no more spamming farms in the mill) and new graphics.

Casual and enjoyable, however very short for its price. I recommend getting it when it's on sale. Like the other games in the series, "easy" 100% achievement. An improvement from the 3rd game, back to the normal non-grindy gameplay. Looking forward for part 2, which will hopefully be longer than this one!

Very grindy compared with the other games of this game series. However a perfect game if you are looking for something casual and enjoyable. One of the more "easy" 100% achievement games. My least favorite in the game series, don't get me wrong though, it's still a fun game! However, if you dislike grindy games I would recommend checking out the other games in the series.

Dans Postal 2 vous incarnez un personnage qui doit, chaque jour de la semaine, effectuer plusieurs sortes de t√¢ches (par exemple : acheter du lait, braquer une banque...) Ce jeu est tr√®s fun, vous pouvez vraiment faire tout ce que vous voulez, seul ou m√™me en coop. ( Õ°¬∞ Õú ñ Õ°¬∞)Les graphismes ne sont pas ouf mais vu la date de sortie du jeu cela s'explique. Le jeu est plut√¥t (beaucoup) violent (regardez quelques screenshots sur la page du jeu). En plus un workshop √† √©t√© ajout√©, ce qui rend les possibilit√©es quasi infinies. ^^ENfin bref, je vous recommande VRAIMENT ce jeu si vous adorez les opens worlds √† la Saints Row/GTA ou vous pouvez faire un peu tout ce que vous voulez, alors FONCEZ !
Tr√®s bon jeu de combat, tr√®s fun en multi et pas cher pour ce qu'il est !

Hotline Miami est un des meilleurs jeux auquels j'ai jou√©, et de loin !Son OST √† couper le souffle, ses graphismes old school g√©niaux, ses diff√©rents niveaux, son histoire tr√®s myst√©rieuse, de nombreux masques... Bref, vous vous amuserez tr√®s bien en repeignant les murs avec de la cervelle de mafieux Russes.Je vous recommande √©videmment tr√®s fortement ce jeu, si vous aimez l'action et le gore !

Project Zomboid est un tr√®s bon jeu de zombie. Il est tr√®s complet, l'immersion est tr√®s bonne, et contrairement √† ce que certains disent, je trouve les graphismes appropri√©s pour ce que peut nous offrir le gameplay (Comme Hotline Miami par exemple). Vous pouvez r√©gler le nombre de zombie dans votre partie solo/online et vous pouvez √©galement h√©berger une partie pour jouer avec vos amis en multi ! (Je trouve quand m√™me l'h√©bergement de parties assez complexe √† r√©aliser). Enfin bon, il reste un tr√®s bon jeu dans l'ensemble et son prix est correct pour ce qu'il √† a nous offrir. Je recommande fortement ce jeu.

Pl√ªtot bon jeu, beaux graphismes, un bon retour aux sources qui fait plaisir, et pour finir : l'un des modes zombies les plus terrifiants et r√©alistes de la saga. Petit point n√©gatif : le prix du jeu, mais vous pouvez toujours l'acheter moins cher en attendant des promos ou m√™me directement acheter la cl√© CD du jeu sur des sites faits pour.

Bon jeu, mais beaucoup trop cher √† l'heure qu'il est. Le mode histoire est en effet plut√¥t fun et vous allez s√ªrement y passer de nombreuses heures avec toutes les missions disponibles, celles qui sont cach√©es, et pour finir la libert√© mise √† votre disposition une fois le jeu termin√©.Mais maintenant, passons √† l'ENORME point faible de ce jeu qui est le mode online :-De plus en plus de cheaters, et Rockstar s'en bat un peu les couilles.-Au contraire, des joueurs n'ayant jamais cheat√© sur ce jeu voient leur argent retir√©, ou voir m√™me sont bannis pour aucune raison valable.-Syst√®me anti-cheat ECO+.-La communaut√© de gros pyjs de 10 ans.-Les prix des choses dans ce mode bordel... au m√™me temps c'est un peu la raison qui pousse les gens √† cheater.Voil√†, j'ai fait un bref r√©sum√© des gros points n√©gatifs de ce mode, et c'est d'ailleurs ce pour quoi je ne vous recommendrai pas ce jeu, sauf si vous voulez jouer tout seul dans votre coin en mode histoire ou en mode libre.

Une bonne grosse chiasse vid√©oludique payante √† la base et devenue gratuite, mais bien √©videmment aucun cadeau pour ceux qui ont pay√© le jeu, en plus d'√™tre une merde graphiquement (et pas que d'ailleurs). Bref : un bon gros foutage de gueule, niquez vous bien bande de gros fils de putes de d√©vloppeurs de morts

In this game you play an angst-ridden hipster chick called Max. She hates herself. Typical things she says is "Cheerleaders it's like they were made in a factory." Basically she's an emo. Some things are a bit old fashioned, like there's an answering machine. Who has those any more? Also she uses a polaroid camera. So I guess this game is set in the 90's. She is more-or-less the same character as Dawson from Dawson's Creek. I liked this game and would like to continue finding out what life is like being a pretentious emo who can turn back time.To make this game more modern they should make her post her photos to DeviantArt. Or put filters on her photos and put them on Instagram.

This game is on the surface a puzzle adventure game. But underneath it is an intense psychological thriller in the manner of the TV series Fargo. There is some good voice acting and even better eye acting. The puzzles range from easy to quite tricky. Mostly they are in the form of logic problems. You might need a pen and paper to work some of them out. It's appears to be set in Canada or somewhere up in the frozen north anyway. Good.

Baldur's gate 3 was a fun and interesting experience which brings Dungeons and Dragons into video game form and is filled with content with my first Run through the early access content alone took me 16 hours and i haven't even been done everything yet if you are looking for an fantasy RPG this will do if you want to play a Co-OP RPG this game also does it although it is still in early access many visual bugs exist and one game breaking glitch with is counter by another oversight of the devs with a floor puzzle having the symbols disappear making almost impossible to pass that area unless you get someone to pick lock a LEVER on a war which is not mean't to happen but I am so happy that it existsHere is a list of things I would like the Dev's to fix and devs to add to the game 1. Fix the Floor Puzzle Glitch (I believe it occurs after leaving the puzzle room and returning to it)2. Many animation glitches Certain NPC's have items/ weapons flying during Dialog3. When switching party members from the camp it would be nice if they didn't spawn at the start of a dungeon you are halve way done because having to wait for a NPC to walk up to you through most of the dungeon after you just talked to him face to face at the camp is weird its like you stop at the door and go wait here until we get back to where we were and then walk to us : )4. Character creation is very good i love it but there is sadly a lack of faces for you to pick more would be nice.5. Please add bard class ;-;6.More of the standard D&D races for players would be great (dragon born, half orc would be great)7. Fix texture load time's please 8. Make it so you can't pickpocket shop owners its a bit over poweredand thats everything i can be bothered to write lol But i can't wait for this game to fully release I'm sure it would be amazing and remember children don't feed the owl bears (unless they are pets or ask nicely)

I love Xcom games even the orginal UFO defence games but this game seems the lack the feel and gameplay style of the other games I'm not saying its a bad game I do actually like this game but it fails the capture the same Intense combat and the sense of dread when you are forced to put a loved Soldier in danger knowing you could lose them for the rest of the game since in Chimera Squad you are given a set amount of Soldiers with set classes and the only customisation being the ability to change the colour of their shirts also when a Operative dies the mission is failed so they can't actually die permanently so you tend to careless about them in general.So play this game if you like a semi-turned base tactical game with set characters set in the Xcom universe but not if you want to play Xcom  say a good 6/10?

So at first I was sceptical about this game since it had a lot of negative reviews, but once I started playing I got hooked.I've been playing with 2 mates and having a lot of fun.About the negative reviews: A lot fo the negative reviews are about the casual playlist being removed, but as of sunday they made one called social which (I think) is pretty much the same.The game has a lot of good gamemodes, very basic, but good gamemodes none the less.Gamemodes include TDM, FFA, CTF and such, but also gamemodes like TDM with only shotguns and Snipers.Not to mention the fact that you can go into custom and make your own gamemode with a lot of modifiers.Some cons about the game:-Inactive Competetive (The competetive seems rather inactive. Qued for like 10 min but didn't get into a match.)-unbalanced Matchmaking (A lot of times you get qued against people who are way better than you and you have no chance of winning.)All in all a good game, especially considering the fact that it's free.If you like games like quake and CoD and want to see them mixed with portal this is the game for you.7/10, would recommend.

This game! This game! It's the best ‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô?game ever!but let's get the cons over with: 1) The game is rather dead, but we can always hope, it makes a glorious return.2) A game takes forever! A game takes atleast 35 minnutes, unless you die early-game, which isn't really better.3) The ranking system is completely ‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•... If you're a player who just joined the game, and therefor is rank 1500, you will most likely meet people of 1900+ in your first match, and it dosn't get any easier, cuz people of high rank can just join a low rank match like it was nothing.4) The first 50 hours, will probably not be incredably fun, since you have to understand the mechanics, and learn to outsmart other players(which feels awesome, if you do it right btw.). I do recommend you play ARK: Survival Evolved, before even touching this game.5) You will be killed in a 100 different ways, before you understand, to watch your back.6) Once you die, you're out. This is the best thing about SOTF(Survival of the Fittest), and the worst, since this is annoying when you get killed, but it gives a freaking rush when you kill someone.Finally! the Pros:1) The rush you get from eliminating/killing another player is amazing!2) The game itself might be rather dead, but the community is still very much alive. If you try unofficial, you'll find tons of cool people, with a lot of wierd settings/gamemodes.3) Once you die, you're out. This is the best thing about SOTF(Survival of the Fittest), and the worst, since this is annoying when you get killed, but it gives a freaking rush when you kill someone.(This is the same, as number 6 of the cons.)4) You have so many possibilities! You can either go for guns, like longneck rifle(classic sniper) simple pistol and simple shotgun, or you could gather some berries/meat and some tranquilizer arrows and go tame creatures like rex, spino, bronto, argentavis, sabertooths, raptors and more! you can also mix crafting with taming and make a combo like an argentavis, a sword and a shield, and then just jump your enemies from the air! or make some c4, and put on a little dodo, and send it to it's death with a huge explosion!I don't know what else to say, but let me know, what you think about the game in the comments! :D
This game is AWESOME! :D You're scared yet you sometimes laugh and you can really go in depth with the game. ^^9.4/10! :D Worth every penny ^^
Awesome game the thing is there's not that much to do :/ when you complete the main Questline you're pretty much done but other than that its rly fun :D

Great action platformer / roguelike with a lot of depth. Choose between five classes, two of which are unlockable and start exploring various locales, such as caves, forests and catacombs. At first, you may be discouraged by the presence of permadeath and instadeath, in the form of spike and boulder traps, but as you progress, your senses will co-ordinate to help you avoid them more easily. There is so much to do in this game, especially as you level up; you can learn new affinities to make you stronger, more dextrous or enable you to perform various class exclusive tricks, such as enchanting, becoming stealthy, receiving holy protection etc. Or just use your wits and combine that poison potion you found with your sword to cause poison damage, or that bomb with an arrow to become Rambo. The fighting and platforming feels great! Defeating the stage boss fills your entire level bar and also feels very rewarding. SInce you can level up only once per stage at the campfire after finishing it, you may choose between being stealthy or just rush to the level boss or just ignore it and gather experience from killing regular enemies. It may seem weird, but personally I like this mechanic, since it adds to diversity and can be used by some playstyles. All in all, Vagante is a hard but wonderfull game with great replayability, that should not be missed. Thumbs up! (9/10)
A great hori shmup and worthy sequel of the original. It feels like playing a true 90's arcade. A definite must buy!  (9/10)
Simple, yet fun twin stick shooter with hectic action and enough game modes to keep you entertained for hours. Leaderboards included for online score competition. Recommended! (8/10)
Excellent sequel to the first RoR, with great gameplay and lots of content. Continuous support from the developer too. Recommended! (9/10)

An incredibly polished shmup from a dedicated dev. Featuring a large assortment of ships, unlockables and modes to choose from, as well as balanced, addictive gameplay and great value for money. See you on the online leaderboards! (9.5/10)

Excellent action roguelike game with great gameplay, a lot of hacking and slashing and heavy risk/reward mechanics. The latter come in two forms: First, it's the curse system, which can be manipulated to an extent and help you, since most curses are give and take, but beware of the final curse that can destroy you easily. Secondly, the evade/parry maneuver. Evading is relatively easy but costs stamina, which is something you need to watch out for constantly. Parrying is harder, needs precise timing, but if you manage to do it, you will weaken and expose enemies for massive damage. Some strategic decisions, like choosing the most helpful item to buy, the currency to use (gold or blood) or the path to follow in the map, will also play a significant role in your adventure. All in all, CotDG is a solid and very addictive game that should not be missed. Thumbs up! (9.5/10)
Fun, endless twin stick shooter / score chaser with roguelike elements. Leaderboards are included, which adds extra replayability. Great value for money. Recommended! (8/10)
Optimized to perfection. An absolute must buy. (10/10)See my original World Ignition review here.

Do you want to feel how it is to be a Mayor? a Civil Engineer? This is it!Cities: Skylines is a  single-player  city-building simulation game. Players engage in urban planning by controlling zoning, road placement, taxation, public services, and public transportation of an area. Players work to maintain various elements of the city, including its budget, health, employment, and pollution levels.If you like the building games then this is totaly a game for you! Easy and full of fun hours till you manage to build your dream metropolis.+Steam Workshop: free goodies, continues to grow by over a thousand new items per day; maps, mods, assets, and tools plus the official dlcs makes game even betterBuild and manage your city. Only limit is your imagination!

Do you wanna feel how it is to be a mafioso? This is a game for you!___You play as Vito Scaletta, a young Italian who returns from World War II to find his mother and sister on the hook to a loan shark. An old friend Joe puts Vito to the organized crime to make some money... It is a great open world, action game!+ProsEntertaining story Full of action and gun fights 50s atmosphereGreat music from that timeThose lovely cars!Many clothesCinematic cutscenes(+Bonus) Playboy covers ;)-ConsCheckpoint systemShooting mechanicsIs this one of the best games out there? Probably!Is this one of the best games i've ever played? Yes it is!

"Can you live with the decisions you have made?" That sums it up perfectly.Simple. Clever. Touching. Another awesome indie game you should try! DISTRAINT is a 2D psychological horror adventure game. You play as a guy named Price who seizes the property of an old woman and tells you the story of his regret!+Pros‚Ä¢awesome sound effects‚Ä¢breathtaking scenario‚Ä¢cute pixel graphics-Cons‚Ä?hard to find something) I would preffer to control the menus by the arrow keys rather than the asdw"What goes around comes around" a tear fell from my eyes...

Awesome as the studio's name! As a zombie game lover i fully recommend this game! Great co-op (and single player) indie game! It combines an action zombie survive game with tower defence! +3 modes to play Defence,Endless night,Deathmatch+co-op, local co-op, (even alone you re gonna love it!)+many guns to play+great graphics for an indie defence game(personaly i loved them!)+awesome sound effects+too cheap to buy it!-(I tried hard to find something)Maybe the chat; because sometimes its hard to see what the other players writing 10/10 Worth any cent! Fully recommended!

column8: While I liked them game and the style I have to say that there are 2 things that could be done better...1. The game starts pretty easy and hit a somewhat high note at some point only to drop that and get slightly harder near the end. It feel somewhat blant if you pretty much don't worry about losing a battle.2. The story feels somewhat rushed and while yes I guess I shouldn't expect a deep story from this it still feels like you just don't get to see enough of these interesting characters and their world.

Probably the best RTS game I have ever played, the voice acting is good, level design is great, and art is fantastic. I think the factions are balanced very nicely while still maintaining distinction and fun factor on all sides. My only gripe is that the AI pathfinding for when you ask a troop to move is a little buggy, larger mechs like to get stuck on things and infantry like to move when you dont want them to after engaging in combat depending on their range or sometimes just not doing anything while being shot if their range is too small. Its a small issue if you do a lot of micro managing when you play RTS games which I do. Back to the faction balancing. For example the exo infantry class, the polanians have a ranged exo with a shield ability that is great for pushing entrenched MGs with some squishier infantry behind it, while the Rusviets exo are a melee class but with an ability to jet into combat from a certain range that is fantastic for taking out any anti mech infantry behind enemy mechs when in a heated firefight. Obviously most classes are the same such as the machine gunners and the anti mech infantry squad but  I have yet to see any mechs on any factions that are remotely similar in their effectiveness. Polanians excel in hit and run tactics, flanking, and taking entrenched positions from multiple different angles, with their high mobility mechs, shield exos and scouts. On the other hand the rusviets excel in taking positions by force, anchoring positions hard and locking down the map, with flame, artillery, and heavy anti armor mechs as well as the close ranged base infantry and bunkers.The story pulled me in and has twists and turns, breezed missions and tough ones all together a very good campaign and I found myself pushing through the hardest missions just to see what happened next in the story. I fell in love with the characters and story which was a pleasant surprise for an RTS since usually I just get annoyed with the characters saying those little quips when you click on them. Overall I would give the game a 8/10 if the pathfinding and AI was a little better I think this game would be perfect to have enemies actually fighting from entrenched positions and pushing up slowly rather than bum rushing your defenses and getting stuck on all the razor wire.

Play this game on extreme difficultly, and you'll start to see why this game is a painfully mediocre shoot em up. But, if  you want to play this game while listening to brutal death metal or even Norwigian black metal in the background. Then go ahead. It will make you go insane.

I will say this, that the game fully works on my system with no issues what so ever. I've been using an Intel i7 6700K, a GTX 1070, and 16GB of RAM.Don't get me wrong, I understand this is a terrible PC port, but 5 years later, the hardware should at least run the game at 60 FPS in 1080p. Also, play the game on a controller and not keyboard and mouse because of the breaking of mouse sensitivity depending on your framerate.But about the game, the combat system is a HUGE improvement from the first game, such as having more options to take down vehicles, and having to equip two mutated weapons instead of picking one using an equip wheel.The story is the cliched family revenge story. But, it's interesting to see a different dirrection tone and focus even though it's not done very well. It's roughly a short 18 hour campaign along with all of the upgrades, side quests, etc.Side missions are also very repettitive, involving the same mission structure every time, but at least they're quick and can be done in less than a couple of minutes per objective.Overall, If you wanna give it a try, I would say go ahead. It's a good game with it's own flaws. just be aware that the game is unoptiumized and the developer of the game "Radical Entertainment" shut down 5 years ago so you can always find community patches and do some research to fix it. A good game, just a terrible port for some users.One more thing: Don't buy this game at full price. Wait until one of the BIG Steam sales to get it 75% off.

So Spec Ops; The Line, is the darkest third person shooter single player campaign I've ever played. But I will say this, it's a very affecting one. The game follows three men in Delta Force out in a post-apocalyptic Dubai to rescue civilians, but things go south very fast. The story begins to question you almost like this "Are you really a hero?" The game is directly based on the novel Heart of Darkness (Joseph Conrad), which gives the force to get it's messages on heroism across in effective and powerful ways. One of the chatacters is even a nod to the author of the book. I say to give it a try for the single player experience. The multiplayer is just tacked on and unless your willing to screw around with your friends in a private lobby, it's dead. Also, the gameplay mechanics are just good old run, aim, and cover shooter mechanics. If your okay with this, then this is disturbing, sometimes beautifully constructed story, using it's Dubai setting to create a hellish atmoshpere that builds with tension and fear.

How to play one of my favorite games "Doom" today: gather all of yoour Doom WAD. files then play it with the great mod Brutal Doom V21 which just came out in it's public beta state. I garentee, you will have yourself a BLOODY BLAST!

Just Cause 2 sports more style than substance.  But, that doesn't take away from the breathtaking open world of Panau.  Story wise is pretty much like the last game and is very forgettable, "Overthrow a corrupt Government by causing chaos in the region".  The main character "Rico" is a very generic action hero badass who is pretty much the equivilance of every 1980s action hero that creates the character.  I felt like the lack of character development and story is done on purpose because really, it's not all that important.  The reason however why most of the substance flaws are made up is because of how much effort Avalance Studious took their time to make the beautiful world as well as the masterfully executed gameplay mechanics this game has to offer including the infamous "grappling hook".  Overall, the story is not important but I recommend this game for the open world exploration, action, and many features of mass chaos.By the way if you don't already know, there is a bug that if you complete the full game of Just Cause 2, it will say 99.99%.  If this happens don't worry because this is only a minor bug and the developers are not supporting the game anymore because of Just Cause 3. Also, this game doesn't have mulitplayer, but there's a mod that someone created and is avalible on steam right now.

The most Influential game of all time.  And it feels as new as it was on the day it was released November, 8th, 1998 thanks to the HD textures. Also, has one the most revolutionary beginning sequences in gaming by telling a story not by B.S. cutscenes, but in the players perspective in real time.  Actually, it's like that throughtout the entire game.  Also has a great soundtrack. The characters are memorable, specifically the silent protagonist "Dr. Gordon Freeman Ph.D".  Along with that, Gordon is not one demensional, even though he doesn't talk he has a back story.Recommend it for all valve fans alike.There're also 2 other expansions that Gearbox software made called Opposing Force and Blue Shift if you want to check those out.

From what the new update bring to the table for Team Fortress 2, we get a nice taste of new weapondry for the pyro, 5 new maps and an interesting new game mode. The CS:GO style assignments are back and those can be done in a blast to unlock the new items. Because I haven't played for a year and when I finally started playing this again, I felt like I was a kid again.

i got this from a friend of mine who bought this for me, and it is a very open world game (more like open universe). you can go anywhere you want in the milky way galaxy, including our own solar system, and every single other star in our galaxy. you can customize your ships to do so many different things, from mining to transporting passengers, to fighting other ships and stealing their cargo, or just collecting bounties (also can be done by destroying other ships). you can land on some planets, but not all, but it is still awe inspiring to be able to land on any selected planet in any solar system in our entire galaxy. you can land anywhere on some planets, and just seeing the general size of the planet as you get closer is just amazing. the developers really di well with this game, on everything.

love the graphics, love the gameplay, and i love the hunting and details with pelt quality. i have played 60 hours, and am enjoying taking my time in this beauty of a game, and i'm not even 40% complete with the game. mind you, that isn't just the story, it also includes challenges, stranger encounters and legendary animal hunts, along with camp upgrades, equipment upgrades, and the beautifully long and curly beard i have grown in this game. compared to all of rockstar's previous games, this is BY FAR the best one i have ever seen, and the only one that i enjoy taking my time with. it is very realistic. not realistic to the point of simulator, but very good at hitting attention to details and game mechanics out of the ballpark. i would highly recommend getting this game.

great audio and graphics, great story, excellent gameplay, and i loved playing the first one, and i love playing this one. you can play this game without too much spoilers to the first game, but i would still recommend getting the first one since it is  complete and has a lot less glitches and helps you get a better feel as to whether you want to play the second one, so you don't get a bad first experience and never want to play something like this game again.
Good graphics, Highly recommend getting the other DLCs, but fun to play with friends.

Using a controller made it much easier to use the heavy machinery, highly recommend getting one (i use an Xbox one). It is a little hard for you to jump onto objects if you don't do it right, but you can still get used to it, and isn't a game changing issue. I ended up stopping playing the game since my controller broke, and made operating the machinery very difficult (for me) to play and advance. Other than that, this is a very good game, a very detailed simulator (one of the best I've seen out there), and i would highly recommend this to anyone.

i have completed this game, and I must say that it is very beautiful. Some ups is, of course, the beauty, along with the slight difficulty of the puzzles within the game. Some downs, not worth $20, although I did get it on sale. Don't get this game if you are looking for a long puzzle game. IMO, good game, other than the price.

[Deck Building]: Basicamente o que torna o Wargame diferente de tantos outros jogos do estilo RTS, a possibilidade de escolher as unidades que se levam para o campo.√â poss√≠vel escolher entre BLUFOR e REDFOR (o cl√°ssico, n√£o √© verdade?), sendo ainda poss√≠vel escolher dentro das mesmas, diferentes na√ß√µes e alian√ßas. √â ainda poss√≠vel escolher especializa√ß√µes, como por exemplo "Motorizado" ou "Mecanizado", ou at√© mesmo data limite para as unidades (por exemplo, unidades anteriores a 1980). Todas estas op√ß√µes resultam numa varia√ß√£o de pontos para a cria√ß√£o dos ditos "Decks" que depois s√£o usados pelo jogador nas batalhas (contra outros jogadores, ou skirmish). Esta √© uma parte importante do jogo uma vez que n√£o s√≥ d√° um certo sabor de costumiza√ß√£o ao jogo como tamb√©m permite o jogador ter um estilo mais pr√≥prio durante o combate, o que consequentemente o torna t√£o diferente de outras op√ß√µes que existem no mercado e ganha o dito espa√ßo no cora√ß√£o dos jogadores que gostam tanto dele. Com isto a an√°lise chega ao fim. O jogo obviamente tem v√°rias mec√¢nicas e afins que seriam demasiado extensos para cobrir numa s√≥ an√°lise, e existe v√°rio material no youtube para tal efeito. Dito isto, uma nota importante a deixar √© que se forem jogar o multiplayer contra outros jogadores devem ter em aten√ß√£o as "premades". Existem v√°rios jogadores que simplesmente gostam de jogar contra novatos para se sentirem melhores com eles mesmos (porque contra bons jogadores n√£o se safam...) e portanto recomenda-se que tentem jogar com jogadores do vosso n√≠vel. Deste modo, dentro dos lobbies, cliquem nos jogadores e vejam os perfis, observando o √≠ndice de vit√≥rias e a quantidade de jogos jogados.E pronto, fica aqui conclu√≠da a an√°lise.Qualquer d√∫vida podem sempre deixar um coment√°rio.Obrigado pelo vosso tempo e bons jogos ;)

Sem d√∫vida que recomendo este jogo, e se tiverem uns amigos para jogar...ent√£o melhor!Este jogo deixou-me bastante entusiasmado, por√©m na altura em que o recebi ainda n√£o havia o F2P, e gosto do facto deles deixarem o jogo F2P para o pessoal ir ao Multiplayer, porque √†s vezes digamos que havia...pouca gente para jogar, e ficariam imenso tempo √† espera para encher por exemplo uma sala 2v2Hoje em dia isso j√° n√£o acontece e em apenas 1m j√° devem estar a carregar o mapa e prepararem-se para a BatalhaO jogo oferece 2 lados, pessoalmente penso que ambos os lados t√™m um pouco de vantagem... por exemplo, os US t√™m o Humvee que oferece um pouco mais prote√ß√£o para o gunner, e dois dos ve√≠culos t√™m aquelas "grades" para detonar RPGs por exemplo antes de atingirem o veiculo o que os torna bastante bons, algo que o lado rebelde n√£o temPor√©m o lado rebelde tem algumas unidades mais baratas, e por vezes conseguem comprar 3 unidades para conquistar 3 localiza√ß√µes diferentes enquanto os US s√≥ conseguem conquistar uma (unidade completa) ou duas (duas unidades completas), pois claro que o poder de fogo diverge um pouco mas depende das t√°ticas de cada jogador e equipa respetivamenteO jogo pode ser frustante de inicio pois algo que temos na cabe√ßa √©: "Vou comprar um tanque e ganho isto de olhos fechados" ... NUNCA DESISTAM, j√° v√°rias vezes aconteceu esfor√ßar no fim (ou outra altura), e √†s vezes enganar o oponente e com umas t√°ticas "geniais" dar √† volta ao jogo e acabar por ganhar... como uma vez ganhei um 95-100 (os objetivos eram atingir os 100 pontos, mas varia) em que o jogo estava 95-8 quando dei a volta e acabei a ganhar os 95-100  :DPronto acho que √© review de hoje e espero que vos tenha ajudade em rela√ß√£o ao jogo, fica a minha opini√£o se for preciso atualizar assim o farei  :D

This isnt the only achievement, its a few more aswell, hopefully they will fix :)Other than this i think the game is very fun to play, recommended!^ Old review ^V Updated review VThe achievements i complained about in the old review seems like it has gotten fixed. So now you can get all the achievements as long your skilled enough for it.Only sad thing is that i had to get SSS on all the songs all over again to get the achievements, but its fine as long as i can actually get them!

Zachtronics taught me that programming isn't just about the program I get at the end, but that the very process of coding and iterating can be a fun and rewarding experience. It's one of the few things that kept me going through my CompSci degree.Last Call BBS is a great game to end the legacy of the indie dev who birthed an entire genre. The Zachtronics games are definitely some of the solitaire games of all time.

This game sneaks up on you. You'll be sitting there, thinking "Hey, it's been a while since I've played that fun little ant-farm airships game..." so you boot it up. You look at it and think, "Sheesh, all these years and all those updates, and it still looks the same? When's Diplomacy coming out?" But you decide to give it a shot and spin up a new Conquest game. Maybe imagine yourself some lore so as to give your ships some kind of unifying theme.All of a sudden, three days have passed. You've designed hundreds of ships, by land and sky but not by sea. There is enough knowledge between your ears to write an entire treatise on Airship tactics, if only you could put to words the sheer bloodshed you have borne witness to. War has raged on your archipelago for generations. Thousands of airsailors have died defending the Brilliant Empress' eternal rule, but your resolve remains- millions more innocents have been slaughtered by those who stand against you. Yet it is not the Borothro Revolutionaries, who sharpen their guillotines in preparation of their next capture, whom you fear. Nor the Alliance, the final remnants of the Old Continent that stood against you. You have seen horrors. Millions of gold's damages caused by a woman and her man-eating machines. An old statue that turned the pride of your nation, the Land-Locked Hulk, to ashes. That damned disk. Moons above, their screams will haunt you til the day you die.yeah this game was fun, can't wait until warcrimes get added. would ruin my GPA again
boat

When you first start playing you think, "Oh, what a cute little game about boats." But then you start figuring out how to sail, then you buy the quadrant and start measuring stars, then you start planning your first trans-oceanic voyage, and before you know it, you've grown a beard, you've memorised an entire playlist of sea shanties and three real-life days have passed. You wonder if you will adjust to life ashore ever again.This happened to me, highly recommend

This tank game is good for those who want a break from War Thunder or World of Tanks. The controls are similar and the logic in these games are practically the same. However this game does have quite a lot of historical errata/inaccuracies...The Type-69I does not as a KTD-1 rangefinder, Type-79 should be Type-69II instead, Type-62 doesn't use RMSH style tracks, they use specific Type-62 tracks. M41D only has 1 row of smoke dischargers and should have a canvas gun mantlet.Textures might need some overhaul but apart from that this game is worth installing

Left for dead 2 One of the greatest video games of our generation maybe even of all time. To experience such luxury for a fraction of what it's worth is absolutely astounding,brilliant,superb,astonishing,incredible,enlightening and pleasant. To gracefully slaughter the undead hordes, Is such a delight. No such elegance can be found in any media or activity. There is no saying how creative and charming the cast of characters are, truly the peak of human psychoanalysis on how to construct an array of characters. Ranging from a Hillbilly who's (questionably homosexual) to a scam artist who enjoys the pleasures of life such as making fun of the hillbilly and his companions.It is not without saying the unique aspects of this game stem not from it's idea but from it's execute as the creative choice to implement original designs of the zombies which reside in this masterpiece and give them special traits which spice up the gameplay and make it 100 times more extravagant and enjoyable. It is safe to say and see that the game which you hope to purchase is without any question or doubt a MASTERPIECE.

This game is actually quite amazing. Not only does it come with a survival game but a horror game mixed in with it like when it becomes night, literally your screen turns black, and then you gotta pray some dude with a AK47 with a flashlight doesn't just demolishes you and your pants while you're running home with a inventory full of loot but that's got me wondering why is that. I know damn well if I didn't have any loot on me I still would've met the same fate so why would he do that ?The game is actually a nice comment about the distrust that human beings have when it comes to our own individual survival, but the culture it has formed around mercilessly slaughtering each other without a second guess is also quite interesting. It's probably a natural psychological reaction towards our own survival that everybody is capable of hurting me and I should be careful of everybody but then it becomes soured by the very moment we spawn on that beach since we probably got either killed by a fully geared AK guy or some naked with a rock and this instilled the belief that you must trust NO ONE.It's an interesting chain reaction of violence that is actually quite real in reality and should be understood as a possible out come of using violence to achieve ones means either through hatred or discrimination. The interesting thing about all this is that no one really cares or understands how immoral all this is (but it's reallly just videogame and haha pixels die)But if the human brain is capable of such violence towards one another through the lens of anonymity and a culture of hatred,caution or spite we humans can become some of the most feral beasts.Let's put a hypothetical idea in your mind, Imagine if in 2203 the Earth is this regressed civilisation with no modern day appliances.You are born in this world and see that people are sparse and few but you met one, a complete stranger, You talk to him and he responds with some funny comment or some nice greetings and you begin to like this individual.You then go and talk about building a house together so that you may survive and become stronger together. He happily agrees and you manage to build a house, He then asks if you want to check something in a box and before you know it, He stabs you in the back with a spear and as you lay their he doesn't make a sound doesn't bat an eye simply looking at you lying on the ground, at his mercy, filled with anger, sadness, despair and betrayal you simply die there and find you are brought back to life on some beach.Now what would any rational person think after experiencing all those emotions and no pay off no revenge. You would never trust a person again. Killing everybody who would harm you as a way to prevent those emotions from spurring up inside again. So you look around and see a man wake up on the beach near you. You then go up to him and kill him, all the while he has to wonder in confusion, anger and sadness why would you do something like this. And then he wonders if he shouldn't trust anybody anymore.
Long story shortRussian kids scream, Kraken ‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô?obliterates my ship.

I like drawing and I've used many pixel art programs over the year, but none seemed to have the same efficiency and workflow I'd achieve drawing more detailed things in programs like Illustrator or Affinity Designer. However, I've had this program for not even an hour as of posting this review - and I've already made more tiles and sprites than I have with most other software in almost a day. It is incredibly simple and intuitive to use, offers a great variety of palettes and great animation tools. I could use the software from moment 1 without any complication and I will certainly use this for all pixel art in future.10/10

Let me get this clear, this game is amazing!It's scratch my itch that was solely missing since Telltale closed.In my opinion, it is even better. It has- Just the right length.- A great plot twisting, captivating story.- Great writing with good voice acting.- Fun and interesting gameplay mechanics (deductions, card collection, choices, etc)- Interesting character- A great ''noir like'' style- and overall really interesting design.On the other hand, there are many graphical issue like- Pretty poor depth of field, that most often than not put subjets out of focus. (I suggest you to turn the option off in the settings)- Element that are hidden from view behind object somehow create some kind of blur on what's in front.- Controls are not great. Movement is impaire way to often when close to wall and objects. It can be hard to navigate sometimes, and interacting with objects sometimes need specific placement that can be cumbersome.In the end, the small issues I have encountered, are exceeded, BY FAR, by all of the positives in that excellent game!

First of wall, this is not meant for the Quest 2.Controllers positions are wrong for this system and smooth movement with joystick are not working properly.Overall quality of the game is pretty sub par.The game is pretty short and half you time is wasted getting your money and wiping your sword from blood and having it against the grindstone.You have ''choices'' but it really, really does nothing, but end your game's short and be put in a different ''stats'' for players.It does not affect the story whatsoever.

Red matter is a great game with a Interesting/captivating story,It is also, one of the best looking VR games I played this far.For those wondering, this is not a scary game. It is not about jumpscare, but just a good tense exploration game.Even though I really enjoyed my experience, here a few points to take into consideration.- It is a short game (around 3 hours) and yet, still pricey.- I disliked the movement controls. Having to press the joystick down to move forward really is weird and counter-intuitive. It will be fine for people who like to teleport, but those who enjoy smooth motion are stuck with pretty bad controls. For the rest. the control overall worked great. I actually liked to select then press the joystick to select stuff with both arms.

I wish I could review this properly as this seems like my kind of game. I bought this to play in VR. First, it cannot be played with the VR controllers. It does require The mouse and keyboard or controller. Meaning that I had to keep having to put on/remove my headset to try and position myself, go back in the VR setting, changes my gardian boundries, but then, the ''position'' you need to be in is really small. If you are out of that physical space, you cant see anything other than a wireframe model showing you where to position yourself. I tried to recalibrate with the VR buttons but it wouldnt work. I had to physically move over and over and somehow, the position kept going further and further.Basically, this game was not made properly for VR. Might be good, well never know, I could never play it.

I was really impressed with this game. It is a very fun mix between action/adventure and managment/economy. Its is suprisingly dense with a big variety of enemies and objetcs. The music is amazing by the way! The only big downside is that past the middle mark, the economy starts feeling kind of broken. You can make cash too quicly and inventory managment mis dungeon gets repetitive and a chore.

If there is one thing Warhammer 40,000: Space Marine succeeds at, it's making you feel like a powerfull ultramarine!The whole weaponry, melee weapons and jetpack combo really help empowering the player and feeling like a war machine.The world is beautifull, the scenery and enviroment really impressive and grandiose.It is a shame that such effort and details were not put into the characters and story.The people you encounter are all bland, with monotone voices and no expressions.The story is also very predicable, I mean laughably predictable.Hopefully, some really epic moments here and there help making the game interesting.What is hard forgive, is a last boss, that simply is quick time action.let that sink in for a moment!I do recommend this game for anyone who like a very simple hack and slash type game and are fan of the warhammer 40k world.If you do not intend to play but wish to see only the best, funniest and important story moment of the whole game, all edited with added special effect and commentaries, make sur to take a look at this video I made.Warning: SPOILERS!https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=UQCxeG9K7jI&t=25s

The new DOOM is a great example that classic game have new entries that still keep the feel of the original.DOOM, stay true to it's roots, embraces it.What made DOOM great back then is what made it great again.- Explorations & secrets- Great weapons- beautiful visuals and smooth performances- Intense / Epic music.The multiplayer aspect is fun, but do not bring much new to the table.It is maybe a little light on maps and demons, but it is still a blast.My biggest problem so far seems to be with hackers, which can be a pain at times.I also experienced a for server crash where all of the experiences, stats etc is lost.Anyhow, overall, I had a blast.To see my 16h+ of gameplay condensed in a video less than 15 minutes, containing only the big story ark, funny bits, commentaries, bugs and edits, please watch this!https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=WhUeOAfBkoc

The Evil Within have been a pleasant surprise. I had heard about this game for a while but never had chance. I had heard that this is a spiritual successor of Resident Evil 4 and a pure survival horror. What I found is a great game, with a complex but quite confusing story, that is indeed a good survival horror, reminescent of RE4, but wuithout the humour or puzzle solving and a little less polished.Overall, I really did enjoy it, but the difficulty is unstable at times and the checkpoint ar not constant, making it very frustrating at times.I do still higly recommend for people who did liked RE4 or dead space.If you want to see a funny and short compilation of my 25h of playthrough, all tucked in a video of about 15 min, containing only the best and funny moment, important story ark and bugs, toped with funny comment special effects and music, please watch my video of this game in my ''In a nutshell'' series!https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=d9xy1BUsXtQSubscribe like and comment, but mostly, enjoy!

It's difficult to describe this one by comparing it to others. Closest I've seen is comparing it to Rimworld and XCOM,  but I also think it's important to include a smattering of King of Dragon Pass in there as well (look it up, it's great!). It's good fun and has loads of depth for those willing to go that far, but it's not overwhelming to the point of obnoxiousness. The writing is good and stands on its own even with procedural generation. I'm glad I supported these devs - one of the few Early Access games that seems actually relatively feature complete. I can't wait to see what they do from here.

Coreless tissue rolls can be produced without having to use an adhesive to form a hollow center. Instead, moisture can be used to promote light hydrogen bonding between the layers of the tissue web that line the hollow center. The hydrogen bonding provides sufficient structure to maintain the shape of the hollow center without rendering the tissue web surrounding the passageway unusable. Passageways can also be formed in accordance with the present disclosure that are substantially circular so that the rolls will easily spin on a spindle. In an alternative embodiment, moisture is not used in constructing the wound tissue roll.In conclusion: I support the manufacture and use of coreless toilet tissue and recommend you make the switch if the option is available in your local area. Please reference US Patent US8535780B2 to verify my claims above.

What are the pros and cons to using coreless toilet tissue?Pros:-benefit the environment by producing less waste and using fewer resources to make the tubes-more tissue per roll-not paying for a cardboard tube that will be thrown awayCons:-will not fit in standard toilet tissuedispensers since there is no large hole in the center, however Kimberly Clark produces coreless rolls with a center big enough for standard dispensersIn conclusion: I would highly recommend making the switch to coreless toilet tissue if you have the option to in your local area.Oh? How is coreless toilet tissue manufactured you ask? Well let me tell you! Directly from the US Patent US8535780B2 for coreless toilet tissue:In general, the present disclosure is directed to a coreless tissue product and to a process for producing the product. The coreless rolls of the present disclosure, in one embodiment, are made from a spirally wound tissue sheet that defines a hollow passageway through the center of the roll. The passageway is lined only by the tissue sheet itself. The passageway can be substantially circular. As used herein, the phrase ‚Äúsubstantially circular‚Ä?means that the circumference of the passageway is free of any cornered or roundness constrictions and is free of any inwardly bulged portions. In one embodiment, for instance, the circumference of the passageway can have a radius that varies by no more than about 25%, such as no more than about 20%, such as no more than about 15%, such as no more than about 10%.Of particular advantage, the passageway can be formed in the spirally wound roll without using a core and without using an adhesive that adheres the inner layers together. In the past, for instance, various types of adhesives, such as starch adhesives, were used to form hollow passageways without the use of a core. Unfortunately, however, the adhesive rendered the end of the roll unusable. Thus, even though a core was not used to form the product, waste was still produced. The present disclosure has found a way to solve the above problem...Please look up the patent listed above for the rest of the process

Absolutely wonderful.Visually, the art style is nothing short of perfection. All the environments are beautifully drawn and never are boring to look at. That in itself is an achievement for a game with four sections and endless replay value.Gameplay-wise, it's a roguelike with an in-depth story, a feat that Hades pulls off with style to spare. This game sends the player, Zagreus, son of Hades, battling through the planes of the Greek underworld with the help of the Olympian Gods in an effort to escape. Along the way, you get blessings and boons from the various gods that determine your playstyle. None of these blessings or boons are without their place, and when enhanced in the right ways enough could easily play a defining role in how each run goes. As the game progresses, more weapons, boons, powers, and perks become available to you, and you will never have identical runs. The Gods themselves are as you'd expect them, a big, bickering family that has many differing views from one another, and questions everything the other does. Their one uniting factor? Getting you out of the Underworld and to their mountain home of Olympus... Or so they think. Meanwhile, your father's goal is to stop that from happening.It is an absolute joy to watch all of the bonds Zagreus forges throughout the game grow to bloom, and it makes dying, normally punished by titles in this genre, actually rewarding in its own way. It effectively takes the sting off of a failed run, and usually kicks off the next, in a neverending loop of "Just one more run..." From the Fury Megaera to the hero Achilles, and even Hades, God of the Underworld himself, the interactions that Zagreus has with these characters have lasting effects in the game's story. I've completed 8 runs so far out of 39 (a lot of those runs were early on, didn't get my first full clear until around 17 runs), and each one has introduced a playstyle completely new to me. One run I've got a spear with a supercharged dashing strike that does over 300 damage per hit and hits 3 times per use, the next I've got a greatsword with 40% of my total health but get 2 life back per hit, dashing with a Zeus powerup that jolts enemies to their ends. Every build runs by your choices, and can easily be redefined and reshaped to suit your needs.All in all, this game will keep me coming back for a long time still. Hades is a masterpiece, and the sort of game that sets a very high bar for an entire genre.
