A top-down stealth/shooter/strategy game where you play as a ragtag band of misfits in the West. There's a lot of depth to this game that, even on the second mission, you're looking at how best to approach each group of enemies. This only gets amplified with each character you add to your roster.One example of this, Cooper can do stealth takedowns at a range by throwing his knife, while Doc can throw his bag out to be seen on an enemy's patrol pattern to lure them in. Once they open that bag, it blinds them, and Doc can ambush. When you mix these two options, you need to weigh which one is better to use where, or if it'd be better to use in tandem with the other. If there's an enemy wearing a pancho, they will not go for Doc's bag, so it's better to use Cooper to take them out. Putting this in action, I used Doc's bag as a distraction for one enemy to pull his patrol pattern away from a Pancho that I had Cooper kill while the patrolling guy was distracted by the bag. When he got blinded, Doc stealth killed him.This game has many ways to approach each group of enemies. Stealth is the main focus so far, but is pretty satisfying to do. You could also just ignore a lot of them if you move right, and then there's going loud, which you'll find there's a time and place for.All in all, the game is beyond what I expected of it so far after picking it up for the sole reason of it being reviewed as overwhelmingly positive on here, and I absolutely look forward to whatever comes next.

GreedFall is a brand new IP that proves that RPGs can still feel magical. The amount of options the game presents you to resolve conflict is astounding. The combat system is a constant dance of damage, dodge, parry, stun, and fury attack, and it feels great in use, yet as I said, I have had a lot of fun finding ways around combat as opposed to launching into it as is common in so many other games. Be it sneaking through a warehouse undetected both in and out, talking your way out of a problem, or using some sort of trickery to distract, there's a lot of different approaches to the game. It also feels like there are a lot of small buds in the story that bloom into larger consequences, though I have yet to reach said consequences. It is rare that I find a game that keeps me wanting to see what the next quest has in store.The perk trees are interesting, you get a point for one of the three at different levels.It feels a bit slow at first but does pick up when you're put on the Island to explore the world they've made.Graphics-wise, I've encountered only a couple bugs that were easily fixed so far, such as the lower part of the chest armor losing its texture (and fixing it by changing gear off and back on). The dialogue looks a bit rigid for how detailed faces are, but unlike some other RPGs, it's not terrible.That being said, some things that bother me are:1) The dialogue doesn't always match the subtitles, which have plenty of typos.2) In the start, your character is getting a portrait painted. It starts as the male character with a voice line  before the character creation. This felt a bit odd, since right after this, you have the option to choose to play a dude or a lady.3) Playing as a female protagonist, you get referred to as "he" sometimes in less important dialogue.These are not too big of deals and can easily be overlooked, but they do feel a bit inconstistent. That being said, I wholeheartedly recommend this game to anyone looking to scratch that itch for a new RPG world to immerse themselves in.EDIT:I KNEW it felt familiar! Spiders made the Technomancer. While I haven't finished that game, I did enjoy the time I spent on it. They've really come a long way since that game, I'd say it'd be worth keeping an eye on any Spiders game that comes out, they're really growing in skill. Give it another few years and a couple more games, we could see them rise to prominence in RPG development.

This game plays exactly how you'd expect Id Software and Avalanche Studios teaming up would. Id knocked the combat, enemies, and gunplay out of the park. The enemy factions all feel unique, Mutants (Muties) are your "hordes pouring out the walls to overwhelm you" kind of enemy, a task they actually do really well in the early game. Goon Squads are the bandits of the game, and you can tell Id had fun making them, their actions are bombastic, from striking strange poses when shooting to hitting a grenade with a baseball bat (which you can interrupt while the grenade is up to do some real damage). There's also the Shrouded, basically they are the more militaristic faction, with armor to match, they're so far my favorite to fight, since there's so many ways you can go about dealing with their armor. Other than that, the Authority is the techie bunch, they look all funky but they aren't too difficult.Weapons. Every weapon you get stays useful. Even the pistol. You will gravitate towards some more than others, but you never feel like another, less used weapon is completely useless. Each gun feels unique and has their own perks, really boosting how you want to play.Perks, this is where things get a bit out of hand. I didn't discover most of the perk trees until I was 6 hours in and finally decided to drop by a main story objective I was passing by, but oh boy, do they affect a lot of the game. You go from a fresh ranger to essentially godhood pretty quick, though that might just be because of how many points I had saved up throughout my time elsewhere. However, this isn't without a bit of pessimism.Bethesda.net.Contrary to what the note says on the Steam page, the game does not actually require a Bethesda.net account, but what binding one to your Steam account does to the game is why this is a negative.Bethesda added a cash shop to the pause menu. Thankfully, not the pause you use most of the time in the game, and the cash shop requires a Bethesda.net account to use, so it's completely optional.As I understand it, Avalanche developed the world. I don't know how, but they somehow created a world that's somehow both full of activity and completely barren of it at the same time. The worldspace has many areas with base objectives, and has skirmishes everywhere in between. Chances are, while you're looting an area you will hear a ton of explosions going off in the background... And you just won't care about it. There's no reason to engage in these skirmishes. Driving between areas, you'll see a Goon Squad or a pack of Muties at most every turn, and normally you just keep going, to the next area where you can truly wreak havoc. Imagine if each of Doom 2016's levels was a location on an open world map, that's basically what Rage 2 does.I'm not a fan of how dialogue is run in the game, you retain full control of your character while the NPC is just... Talking. Occasionally your character will respond, but there were multiple times where I straight up ignored contacts while running around in circles just waiting for something to happen.The larger locales are fun and interesting to explore most of the time, but eventually you end up running through each area again and again until you find that one last crate (there's a perk for that). Now for the meh part of this... Vehicles. Really, there's not much to it, you get one you can upgrade and a bunch that you can also summon at will including a hovercraft that lets you fly about the map...But let's go back to that one you can upgrade for a second. This tank of a car has machine guns, rockets, a radial pulse, you name it. It even has a voice companion akin to an 80's action movie supercar, but it has just this one problem...It.Does.Not.Shut.Up.This should be one of the first things they patch post-launch, the voice is constantly droning in that car, it ruins how much you can enjoy it. Unfortunately, it is in the one vehicle you upgrade. Otherwise, the vehicular combat is OK at best. It's decent, but it kind of feels generic at this point, with similar systems in games like Borderlands. It just doesn't do what the ground combat does.So why was this review a thumbs up, you ask?Because the combat is truly amazing and really carries the rest of the game. I don't regret buying the game at full price because of it, and while I do wish the map was more interesting, I'm having a ball wreaking havoc around the Wastes. Id really did a fantastic job in making an entertaining combat system that, if you want a Doom-esque open world game to fool around in for a few hours at a time, this is a great candidate.

Nothing's as satisfying as being down to your last unit assaulting a base, remembering you're Captain Cutter, and dropping a metric ‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô• of Helljumpers on it, telling them to all fire rockets and seeing that base cease to be.

Great game, great combat, great gameplay in general.However, the game's matchmaking is just plain stupid. Peer to peer connections instead of a dedicated server? This is 2017, Ubisoft, a AAA competitive title should have DEDICATED SERVERS to prevent hosters from leaving, ending the session. That said, just finding a game half the time is a pain. You'll wait for a minute and just have it say, "Session is full. Try again." or "Unknown error, try again."Another thing, for a AAA title that just got released, it is VERY difficult to find players around your skill level, even though the matchmaking system (which, by the by, you can't do any customizations while searching for a match) has a line regarding player skill. Oftentimes, you'll get that line to say no limit, meaning you either obliterate the enemy or get utterly steamrolled. This also affects bot matches, of which the difficulty cannot be set by an option, which makes the bots go from 1 (easy) to 10 (godlike future-sight hellbeasts), but no control is given to the player to set it themselves as it is.As I said, the game is great. The combat is great. The gameplay is great. The matchmaking and hosting are absolute trash. That is what ruins the game. I don't doubt that this might just eventually get fixed to be bearable. Until then, I just can't recommend the game to new people, the matchmaking system is too horrid.

Let me preface this by saying those looking for "more Meat Boy" aren't going to find it here. This is a game which takes many queues from McMillen's previous titles, but turns them into it's own beast. A story containing elements from Time ‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•, gameplay similar (BUT NOT IDENTICAL) to SMB, and kickass music inspired by classical pieces. I liked all the parts here, and was excited for the game prerelease. So then, why have I only played it recently, and only about halfway? To put it simply: other games. I really hate to say it, but TEIN is a relic of game design past, the platforming is not as precise as, say, Celeste. The story is almost non-existent, or at the very least intentionally vague in traditional McMillen fashion: lacking a satisfying payoff for the sometimes insane levels of difficulty pushed through. As expected from a McMillen game however: the art direction is top notch, with every level/chapter having a very distinct mood.Celeste comparisons are rife due to the release windows only being 6 months apart, but I think they're fair comparisons to make. Celeste is a masterclass in platforming, music, art design, story even! Most anybody who's played Celeste (if you somehow haven't do it now) will agree with me about these points. As a near-lifelong fan of McMillen games, it pains me to say Celeste is just a better game.So, why is this review positive? It must seem like I dislike this game so far based off of everything I've said but I truly don't. It's more than a little rough around the edges, and certain mechanics could've used more thought to flesh out. A great example of this is the interconnected world design, TEIN is laid out like one big level with sprawling screens in every direction, something which visually is pulled off flawlessly with smooth transitions. I don't hate this idea, but in practice it generally ends up just being annoying. Having to run through an entire chapter simply to grab a tumor in the last screen is incredibly annoying, this can usually be solved by going to the next chapter and clearing levels backwards, which sadly isn't always possible. Despite all these shortcomings, this is a game which is very easy to lose hours in. Booting it up I would often find myself facing down a clock upon realizing just how long I had been playing. I enjoyed my time with this game, but feel no desire to replay it, and don't believe it will be remembered in the same vein as McMillen's other games. It's also really f***ing hard, something I try not to let influence my review or opinion, but it has to be said somewhere just so the reader is aware.TL;DR: Very hard game, feels slightly unpolished compared to McMillen's other work, but is a fun time nonetheless and very much worth your money in terms of content present. Just be ready for minor annoyances here and there.

This game is fantastic, despite only around half of it being currently available. There isn't much I can say that you haven't already read in the other reviews, but I was having such a good time learning to P-rank every level I felt compelled to write my thoughts. Once you get "into a groove" with the movement mechanics the game truly comes alive, flying around every arena popping heads with the marksman revolver (or any of the unique weapons) is truly incredible fun. This game benefits from the focus of having a singular dev, and no idea feels wasted as result, every arena feels expertly crafted around how strong V1 can be in the right hands, creating new challenges that test your limits around every corner. Don't even get me started on the fantastic secret levels, I won't give any of those away, but know that they're all something special in their own right.Buy this game, follow it's development, be happy.TL;DR: Remarkably Challenging, Incredibly Fun, Fast Paced, Fantastic.

Chivalry 2 is a casual, yet rewarding multiplayer fighter.  The core gameplay loop is deceptively complex, allowing unexperienced fighters to help/participate in the team battle while still allowing skilled players to capitalise on forethought and correct reads.  64 player gamemodes are always a great deal of fun, with Duel servers being an excellent place to improve your technical skills and experience.   Compared to Mordhau (which this game often is), it is more accessible and comedic.  This promotes a casual and fun-loving experience, where players are more commonly cooperative and flexible as opposed to intense and skill-driven.  The team-based objectives and maps are much more similar to a Fantasy movie mega-siege than a gritty and realistic depiction as in Mordhau. Classes and weapon choices are varied, with all itches being scratched and no playstyle left out.  There is a "meta", however every weapon is effective if you spend enough time learning it.  The class system in my opinion is a large contributor to the games more team based gameplay.  Players don't need to specifically choose to add a medkit to their loudout to help the team, instead anyone using a Footsoldier subclass will be forced to have medkits as their ability. Overall I can strongly recommend this game if you are even remotely interested.  If you like the idea of battlefield but with a medieval setting, this game is for you.  All players, whether completely inexperienced or veterans of the franchise are welcome in the community.  Because of the light and casual nature of this game, you should not worry about being "bad", as you will surely improve quickly due to the subtle learning curve and have fun regardless of whether you win or lose. -For the Masons!  <3

WARNING:  This review is written for the gameplay and mechanics of the game, NOT the poor optimisation at launch (which is a huge issue).   (TLDR)---The game is currently unrefined and poorly optimised as of release, however the gameplay is still incredibly fun.  Returning the beloved modern shooter setting to battlefield's recently developed approach to gunplay and classes.  HIGHLY RECOMMEND considering that every Battlefield game has started out rocky at first, the gameplay is so fun I can easily overlook the janky framerate and bugs.  ----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------(OVERVIEW)---  Battlefield 2042 harmoniously blends the incredibly satisfying gun-play from the previous entries (BF5, BF1) with the modern shooter setting from the classic entries (BF3, BF4, BFBC2) to create an overall enjoyable experience.  There is a large focus on making BF2042 a culmination of all previous games using their custom match creators with other games content, along with the mechanics from later entries.  (GUNPLAY & GAMEPLAY)---  In this game, the system for applying attachments to your weapons has been completely reworked.  Instead of creating your dream gun in the menu screen and being stuck with the specifications the whole match, you can choose between a personally selected few attachments for each slot to freely swap between at any point as a footsoldier.  This opens up the versatility for ALL WEAPONS immensely, allowing you to turn your long range marksman rifle into a suppressed, high fire rate, short range semi auto in the span of roughly 4 seconds.  This ability to adapt your weapons at any moment creates an incredibly fast paced atmosphere in game, where players are no longer forced to sit back just because their gun has a 4x scope.  You essentially get 3 gun loudouts inside of your one gun, this is a huge contributing factor to the overall enjoyment of this game and is being well received by most I have asked.  The class system has also been revisited.  Players still have 4 weapon / gadget loudout slots (Assault, Medic, Engineer, Sniper) for their custom weapon classes, however players can now choose from a roster of operators that each have a passive and active ability.  Your loudout slots can be freely changed between each of your operators, so you can for instance still use snipers on your assault classes and vice versa.  This change is welcome and allows for more individualised player experience, however doesn't encourage teams to work together in terms of role choice.  You are no longer FORCED to heal people just because you want to play a medic gun, or forced to repair vehicles if you want to use an LMG / Shotgun.  This has inadvertently reduced the amount of support roles in matches, leading people to play selfishly.  (MAPS & GRAPHICS)---  Battlefield 2042 looks superb, everything from the dirt under your boots to the unrelenting tornado to your left is soaked in battlefield beauty. Stunning reflections and light, ridiculously sharp shadows and textures allows you to get completely sucked into the gameplay.  The models and attachments of the guns are beautiful also, each having an impactful unique sound, firing mechanism and reload animation.  Explosions, fog, water and even the rain hitting trees leaves you with an open mouth as you're transported to any of the games unique maps...Conquest has only a handful of maps, each being incredibly different from each other but felt mostly underwhelming.  There is an immense amount of verticality to the maps due to the introduction of a wingsuit and more traversal options, which encourages moving from point to point rapidly.  The introduction of the attachment changing system had a major affect on the engagement distances of the maps, often left with large stretches of flat and open ground inbetween large (almost mini maps inside themselves) conquest objectives that players are encouraged to flip flop between constantly using their adaptive arsenal and ON THE FLY vehicle summoning. (OVERVIEW)---    Battlefield 2042 feels fantastic, offering a sometimes overwhelmingly fast paced and adaptable gameplay loop that will either be what you LOVE about this game or what you HATE.  There is much less of a focus on cohesive team operations and cautious advances to objectives, and more of a focus on lightning fast, constantly changing gameplay.  It feels more like a 128 player Titanfall with Battlefields' typical hilarious shenanigans and will definitely have it's moments making you laugh your ass off due to the sheer chaos of 128 players (and it being a battlefield game of course).  I HIGHLY RECOMMEND this game, it's a fresh foundational approach to battlefield that does a great job of cementing itself into the next-gen wave of video games.  There is plenty to like, and if you enjoy shooters I can GARUNTEE you will find fun in this game one way or the other.  AS OF RELEASE however, do be wary of the poor performance and unbalance, you can thank EA for that...

This game is a spectacular experience that has been built from the ground up for VR and it shows.  Every gun feels satisfying to use and is accurately responsive to their real life counterparts, you can really feel the difference between every weapon you use.  This game has a variety of gamemodes to keep you entertained with online play, much like other popular FPS shooters it has Search & Destroy, Team Deathmatch, Free For All, Gun Game and even some weird ones like Zombies and Trouble in Terrorist Town (with more made by the community).  Honestly it's a must buy if you have a VR setup, even to experience it just once.  It can be played like any other shooter but just in a virtual world and it's great.  HIGHLY Recommend.

A superb example of what VR horror games have been needing, a complete immersion into a terrifying and dark area.  Creeping around every corner with the utmost of caution as not to disturb the ever-present and dooming threat that is the ghost.  Every single ghost interaction I have had in this game, inside of VR and on desktop, has been truly heart dropping.  If you want a genuinely high quality and terror fuelled game that has very fun and repeatable missions, I would highly highly recommend this game.  This game has given me something fresh and exciting with it's varied locations and in depth ghost hunting strategies and I cannot recommend it enough.  Even if you absolutely hate horror games and you could never imagine yourself playing it, I recommend that you do.  Being full of absolute dread in a situation like that in Virtual Reality gives you such a rush that is so difficult to explain.  This game can be played completely solo, but I personally wouldn't recommend it.  The game becomes much more technical based and team oriented when you can play with friends or even randoms that you find in public lobbies.  Awesome graphics, absolutely stellar sound design that perfectly encircles you in mysterious and anxiety inducing creaks and bangs around the house. It truly makes you feel like you're being watched, or even the feeling of being in the same room as the entity is super immersive.  You will KNOW when you're near the ghost, or when IT is near YOU... Highly Recommend!!!  Please expose yourself to this awesome game and contribute to the developers making it even better!!!

I needed to wait until I finished this game before I reviewed it, but...This game is an absolute blast, with so many layers of ridiculous and satisfying melee combat that slowly builds up over time and playthroughs. I finished the game on the highest difficulty available to me when I started, then instantly started another playthrough in the NEWER highest difficulty. This game is possibly the hardest game to review, because on paper this game sounds really boring and tedious. But I can assure you, there is something ominously attractive about this game. Not only is it absolutely stunning in terms of visual quality, it also runs incredibly well with mediocre computer hardware. The story (So far) is thrilling, enigmatic and leaves you wanting to delve even deeper into the rich story and excellent cinematography. As for the gameplay, it is described as a "Walking Simulator" which is simultaneously accurate and dead wrong. You would be surprised how many factors go into "just walking from point A to point B", such as.... How many ladders should I bring (Each taking up valuable cargo space)? Will I need to cross through hostile territory? Will I need to cross rivers or large ravines? If I need to go through hostile territory would it be safer to take one large haul and risk not being able to outrun my enemies or should I take 2 separate deliveries which can allow me to run faster and possibly escape losing all my loot? All these and many many more.The variety of situations you can land yourself in this game are seemingly endless and each decision you make can vastly affect the outcome of your deliveries. This is supported by the games (sometimes overwhelming) incredibly versatile and complex menu systems. Each piece of cargo can be carefully stored in different ways on your body, allowing for maximum efficiency when it comes to carrying large stacks of cargo at once. This also includes the use of vehicles, tools and weapons to take the approach that you want to take. All this and I haven't even mentioned that this game has online elements! There is no direct interaction between players, but instead the game utilises a system that allows for player's ladders, postage boxes, climbing ropes and even BRIDGES to carry across each others worlds. If there is a large river in a particular section of the map that is commonly crossed, you can guarantee that the community has collaborated to aid in the construction of a bridge that can allow players to safely cross. You don't see other peoples creations until you reach a specific building in that sector of the map, so the first time you enter an area you are made to adapt using only the tools in your disposal but once you reach the building, you can make use of the player created objects. This makes for easier trips when you have to go back and forth and really brings a sense of collaboration to the game.Overall, I would highly recommend getting this game. Not only is it amazing from a gameplay perspective, but the story is one hell of a ride that not many other games can give you. This game can be and SHOULD be GOTY with this PC release. Trust me, you will get hooked a lot quicker than you expect.

This game is like crack, I can't put it down!!!Seriously, this game will give you the most rewarding experience from a first person shooter you've probably ever had. It's a pretty good game so far. I've played for probably around 9 hours now and I can say that I've more or less done everything the game has to offer, at least enough to get a good sense of the gameplay loop.The Pros:Very clean and sharp UI.Good voice acting, detailed cinematics. (This may seem like an odd thing to put in a review but a lot of early access games cheap out in these departments. The fact that they did not is a good sign.)Fantastic Visuals.The factory/ship interior mechanics were very fun. They slammed Tetris and Factorio together and somehow managed implement it into a city builder in a way that worked. Balancing your factory interiors so that they had proper power distribution, ample employee access, all while maximizing your space usage was very entertaining. Most of my time was spent doing this.The Cons:The one part of this game that doesn't really make it just yet is the combat/strategy system. It's clunky to say the least.Once you're finally at the stage of the game where you are making ships, you are able to build in the interior of the ship similar to a factory. You can design the interior as you please, putting shields, guns, etc. This part isn't really a con, in fact I highly enjoyed designing my ship. Gave me FTL vibes. After about 20 - 30 minutes of designing your ship to be nice and symmetrical with a perfect fuel-to-power ratio, you can finally launch it. Lets go take it for a spin, you think. So you fly it over to the nearest rinky-dink rebel base nearby and... a turret shot it 5 times and its destroyed. You can't save what you placed as a template of anything, so you will have to design your ship all over again. If you did manage to peel your ship out of there in time to take it back to your shipyard, enjoy waiting for the ship to repair. And I hope for your sake you don't have more than one ship, because controlling more than one ship is a mess. Repairing more than one ship is a mess. Fighting with more than one ship is a mess. Did I mention that the ships can only attack in a 1v1? With the exception of turrets. Turrets can shoot you while you're in a 1v1 with another ship. Did I also mention that when you fight with another ship you are locked in and cant retreat? By the way this whole engagement took place in about 30 seconds. The fleet you spent a long ass time painstakingly designing was defeated by some rebels armed with the space equivalent of a 2004 honda civic because they locked you into an 1v1 while their ground turrets wrecked your ships. Verdict: Very solid foundation. Will likely be a very fun game in the future. Only about 12ish hours worth of content so far. Combat system is a huge mess though.

I bought the mass effect series on the 3rd of June. I finished all three games by the 14th of June as I am posting this. Meaning it took me 11 days to go through the three games. I have 132 hours playing this. 132/24 = 5.5.So I spent equivalent of 5 and a half days on this game within the span of 11 days. 5.5 Days Played - 11 Days Since Purchase = 5.5 Days doing real life things.Therefore If I were to evenly distribute my playtime over those 11 days since purchase, I would have played Mass Effect for an average of 12 hours a day.I am unsure if I have a problem or if this was just a really good series. Probably both.Tldr; I spent 12 hours a day for 11 days playing this series. This is a very good series.

This game saved my life.I am 27.My ex-wife and I have a daughter together, and adopted our son together. They are now both 4 years old.When we were going through our separation, I found myself lost and miserable. I was self destructive. I got so mad one day from everything spiraling out of my control that I punched some concrete in a moment of overwhelming emotion. That caused me to break my 5th metacarpal in my right hand... my working hand... my games hand.. the hand that I held and carried my children to bed with.. The hand I desperately needed to make sure I could continue to provide.After learning of the severity of my self-inflicted damage, I was borderline suicidal. Keep in mind that just a few months before this, I was the happiest man with no history of depression or anxiety. I have never had fits of rage, or been one to break down and cry, but I was in a low spot that just really buried me from being able to see the light on the other side.Having nothing better to do, I searched for a game I could play, ONE HANDED while I recovered. I somehow stumbled upon this game and read some of the reviews. I decided that it had to be worth a shot... I must admit, I didn't beat the game, or play nearly as long as some of you. In fact, I may have only played this game a day or two.. With that being said, after doing so, I had a new found joy and hope for life. I was able to put behind me the pain and suffering that had been cast over me. I was able to experience other peoples joy and happiness. I was able to see the fruits of my "labor". I relaxed for 5 ‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô?minutes to this music long enough to realize that I was going to be okay.After coming to that realization, I turned the game off, and I went back to work. It hurt my hand like hell but I was motivated. I stopped feeling so damn sorry for myself, and I became the father I needed to be in that moment, not the weak boy I was behaving as.Today, I am close friend with my kids mother. We don't fight, or argue, or say hurtful things to each other. We are parents, and friends.I now have 3 kids. My third child is, wait for it, ALSO 4 YEARS OLD. The woman I am with was going through a very similar situation at the time of my own separation, and we just stumbled in to each others life unexpectedly. We have been in a relationship for a year now, and are very happy together.Moral of the story, you never know what life holds in store for you, and if I would have given up when all the odds were stacked against me, I wouldn't be where I am today. This silly little game helped me realize that.Thank you

A really solid puzzle game. If you like portal, you will love this. The story wasn't amazing but definitely not bad. a bit short? I played 2 hours and felt I got what I needed out of it, but it was a satisfying experience all the way through. The gameplay was kept fresh throughout all of it with various changes to your core ability as you play through. If you have the money to spare and want a good FPS puzzle experience, get this game.

I got this 2 days ago and I completed all the endings, by far the best narrative game I've played. The entire plot is so elegantly done with genuinely good plot twists and changes. All the characters are well done, nothing is cringy. If you are into mythology, thats an added bonus, tons of references and allusions to various legends. Amazing world building, you can discover things about characters by seeing where they live n such. The mechanics and lore are all consistent and make sense within the world.It feels satisfying to figure things out but nothing feels hard.And I can't say anything more because figuring out everything yourself is the best part. This game is worth every penny. Do me and yourself a favor and play it.10/10Literally the only thing negative thing I can think of was that the combat (what little there is) wasn't amazing, however I played exclusively with a controller and can imagine it being far easier and better with mouse and keyboard.

ROR 2 isn't a REALLY terrible game by any means. Also, I have not played ROR 1, and I've heard that this game is very similar to that so if you liked the first probably you should get the second. With that said, my biggest issue with this game is pacing, or lack there of. There is never EVER rest time in ROR 2 aside from the few seconds in between levels that it loads. Enemies are constantly spawning, constantly getting stronger, and it feels like you never stop shooting. Along with that, the guns, at least for the commander, feel very weak and never through out the game do they feel legitimately strong or fun to use. Which isn't a big issue, until you realize thats the whole game. The combat loop feels like DOOM in many ways, except even less pacing than that game and also without all the cool aspects that make that a fun power fantasy. The upgrades are cool I guess though, although since its all randomized theres not really a way to "build you own playstyle," unless you already know what each upgrade does (it doesn't tell you until you pick it up) and exclusively use the rare 3 item "shops," that show up. Not a bad game, and there's definitely people reading this who will love it, but I can't recommend it as I just don't have fun with it.

If you have any confusion on what this project is, its basically the Garry's Mod of VR and hands down the best game you can purchase for VR (in my opinion). Why? Well it right off of the bat there is an official CS:GO mode, a "The Hidden" mode (like from gmod), a trouble in terrorist town mode, WW2 battles, battle royal, team deathmatch gamemodes and more.But thats not even half of it, it is super moddable and incredibly easy to do so too.It runs on Unreal 4, and anyone can freely make maps for this game. Not only that, you can make custom objects using Unreal's blueprint system.What this means is entire games can be built with Pavlov.You can play call of duty style zombies in this as a result which is one of the most fun gaming experiences ever. All the maps are being remade, and I'm even making a map for that mod as I'm writing this. TTT started as a community mod as well until it became packaged in. There's other sick gamemodes as well. And also this means that in theory literally any game could potentially be made, if your a programmer looking to dip your foot into VR, this is an amazing place to try (whole games have been made in Unreal's blueprint).So yeah, this is a game that is jam packed with amazing content, a sick community that is a blast to play with, and could in theory be any game if someone makes an attempt to code it.

BEFORE YOU MAKE A DECISION BASED OFF THAT I DIDN'T RECOMMEND THIS READ ON. TL:DR Only get if you have fun just messing about. There's no structure to anything, but the combat is great. (good test, could you play garry's mod alone without mods for an hour and have fun? Or could you play Unreal tournament, csgo, tf2 or similar multiplayer games only with bots and all items unlocked from the get go? If you think you could, then you might want to purchase this, otherwise I wouldn't recommend it.) Okay so this game is really good! The combat is SOOOO fun and it gives you so many options.For instance, i was able to pickup someone by the throat, grap their weapon from their hand, and use it to kill them.Or you can basically use the force to pickup objects and use them as shields or throw them at enemies.Or you can use spells to stun your opponent before running up to them and killing them.So then why don't I recommend it?There's no sense of completion in any of it, and along with that there isn't much room for customization in difficulty and how everything is setup.There's no multiplayer or campaign or structured levels. Instead there are currently 4 arenas to pick fromand in them you pick a difficulty ranging from easy to very hard and a wave. That or a few special game types like 1v1sor endless. Also, there's not much available in terms of customization for the waves. You have 2-3 waves for each difficulty. You can't change any health modifiers or customize what enemies come or what weapons they have. So there are a ton of weapons you just won't see from NPCs and have to get from a weapon rack. I really wanted to increase the difficulty a bit but not to the extent of very hard. Like needing to be hit 2-3 times before dying instead of what feels like 10. But I didn't have that choice. It was either I was a tank or I get killed in 1 hit. Although the combat is a blast, it was hard for me to enjoy it because of this unstructuredness to everything. There was no sense of accomplishment because all the weapons, spells, enemies, and options are just available to you. For some people thats completely okay, they're fine with just messing about, which is great and i'm super jealous of that. But its hard for me to feel like its worth playing a game if theres nothing structured to accomplish. So I would recommend they add in some full sets of levels instead of just picking and choosing waves. Along with that, if there was workshop compatibility for those campaigns or custom arenas, that would be really good too. The easiest thing to implement that would help a lot is also more customization and the ability to save your custom waves. That way you can tailor the game to what you want a bit more. Also a multiplayer mode whether that be co-op or vs would be neat as well. I find that multiplayer games fill that gap i was describing earlier just by being multiplayer.

An absolutely beautiful fun game. I would highly recommend it to anyone.It has simple yet very depthful combat and movement and the level design emphasizes that.The sound effects and music fit the game's theme perfectly, you can tell from every detail that passion was poored into this project. Wonderful game feel, navigating menus feels nice not to mention the usage of it for combat where hitting enemies with your sword feels very nice and has a weight to it. The artstyle is wonderful as well, like the combat simple but also very fitting. Beautiful is the perfect word for this game, as every aspect of it could be described with that. Everything from the sound to the combat its all just beautiful. This is a brilliant game. My only grip is the boss fight (the first one at least as its the only one I've seen) is just terrible. Its not a great test of the player's skill and all it is is frustrating and annoying, its a stain on an otherwise amazing game.Once again, would recommend!

Far cry 3 was one of my favorite open world games ever and I'm a big fan of open world games in general. And I would say without a doubt that this is my favorite Far cry game and one of my favorite open world games ever, though every game does have flaws. So I'll quick state what I like about the game, and what I didn't below.Pros- Streamlined mechanics like no animations when looting bodies make the game so much smoother and much faster in a good way- Pretty graphics - Addition of planes and helicopters which are extremely fun- Really good story that kept me engaged till the end- Better NPCs, taking outposts quietly can actually be a challenge now since the AI aren't a bunch of morons who can't see you during mid day when you are 50 feet in front of them and most large scale fights can now be pretty hard, which I enjoy- Fun side missions and places to explore, really like listening to some of the phone recordings since many are funny or can give some background, which helps the story out- Good car customization options- Fun gunplay- Hunting and fishing are suprisingly fun and worth it at the same time- Guns for hire can actually be useful and are fun to use, though I don't really care much for friendly NPCs much- Fat bear with diabetes named cheeseburger that licks you- Weapon that sends you into another dimensionCons- Side missions and main missions can be very repetitive at times(I finished every single mission except for one damn one I can't find in jacobs region)- Ok gun customization, but there are so little guns it is kind of annoying, like there are 3 different magnums and all of them are exactly the same, they just look different and I feel like there could of been so much more for how big the game is- So many Grunts my lord, at the beggining they are awfully annoying because there are so many- Autodrive is still pretty bad, though I didn't use it much- The missions where you collect things hidden all over the map are TERRIBLY BORING- Minor bugs like needing to down a friendly person and pick them back up to be able to talk to them cause they think that they are constantly in combat- Few game crashes(happened like once or twice in 40 hours and one was in coop so no big deal really)- Minor frame rate drops(happened about 5-10 times, but would go back to normal in about 5 seconds)- Hard to find some missions which can cause some frustration LIKE ME NOT BEING ABLE TO FIND THE LAST MISSION IN JACOB'S REGION SO I CAN FULLY BEAT THE GAME IN EVERY WAYIn conclusion, I really had fun with this game and will be returning maybe more than once jsut to replay the story with friends, and while the gameplay can be very repetetive sometimes, thats just something that I can deal with since the game is so expansive. So overall I would give this game an 8/10

So far has been my favorite RPG since skyrim and the first single player game I can actually stick with for long amounts of time. Almost everything so far has been amazing but there are a few cons- Not great FPS but with a 1070 on very high I consitently get 50-80 FPS in cities and 70-100 in rural areas- Bad FPS drops, sometimes down to 0 for around 3 seconds at a time, but thankfully the game actually pauses for that amount of time so it won't affect conversation or battles(Pretty rare BTW)- Annoying 2-3 second black loading screen just to talk to an NPC, but generally not too bad- Some bad voice acting and bad lip sync and player movement during talking and cut scenes but most of it is spot on- Sword fighting and other mechanics are quite hard to learn at first because this game really doesn't hold your hand, which it was designed to do, but after the first few missions you get most of the mechanics down quite well. Just remember it's a little hard at firstSo far thats all I can think of for cons which is pretty damn fantastic for a independent release! I highly reccomend this game, but only to people who have the proper specs ATM because of optimization issuesAnd don't let your view of the game get tarnished by the some people who got the game with too low specs of a computer or just plainly get their full few of the game from it's graphics and optimization, which in both respects are pretty damn good.Recomended 9/10!

Townscaper is really easy to play. Everything you do feels and looks great, and there's a lot of different mechanics that you can learn about. I personally fell in love with the lighthouses in the beginning, but as I kept playing and I discovered the gardens I fell in love again. This game put me in a trance almost, it's like the video game embodiment of a habit I've had all my life... summed up, it's wonderful, and I can't wait to see what features get added next.The asymmetrical and random map structure also makes it really interesting to play as well, I found that quite amusing while starting my city. It creates unique challenges and unique shapes that are really pretty most times.

INDUSTRIAL SOCIETY AND ITS FUTUREIntroduction1. The Industrial Revolution and its consequences have been a disaster for the human race. They have greatly increased the life-expectancy of those of us who live in ‚Äúadvanced‚Ä?countries, but they have destabilized society, have made life unfulfilling, have subjected human beings to indignities, have led to widespread psychological suffering (in the Third World to physical suffering as well) and have inflicted severe damage on the natural world. The continued development of technology will worsen the situation. It will certainly subject human beings to greater indignities and inflict greater damage on the natural world, it will probably lead to greater social disruption and psychological suffering, and it may lead to increased physical suffering even in ‚Äúadvanced‚Ä?countries.2. The industrial-technological system may survive or it may break down. If it survives, it MAY eventually achieve a low level of physical and psychological suffering, but only after passing through a long and very painful period of adjustment and only at the cost of permanently reducing human beings and many other living organisms to engineered products and mere cogs in the social machine. Furthermore, if the system survives, the consequences will be inevitable: There is no way of reforming or modifying the system so as to prevent it from depriving people of dignity and autonomy.3. If the system breaks down the consequences will still be very painful. But the bigger the system grows the more disastrous the results of its breakdown will be, so if it is to break down it had best break down sooner rather than later.4. We therefore advocate a revolution against the industrial system. This revolution may or may not make use of violence; it may be sudden or it may be a relatively gradual process spanning a few decades. We can‚Äôt predict any of that. But we do outline in a very general way the measures that those who hate the industrial system should take in order to prepare the way for a revolution against that form of society. This is not to be a POLITICAL revolution. Its object will be to overthrow not governments but the economic and technological basis of the present society.5. In this article we give attention to only some of the negative developments that have grown out of the industrial-technological system. Other such developments we mention only briefly or ignore altogether. This does not mean that we regard these other developments as unimportant. For practical reasons we have to confine our discussion to areas that have received insufficient public attention or in which we have something new to say. For example, since there are well-developed environmental and wilderness movements, we have written very little about environmental degradation or the destruction of wild nature, even though we consider these to be highly important.

I don't think it's necessary to write an actual review, you already know the drill. You play as a goat and destroy everything. Also, you can stick your tongue onto everything (including living creatures ( Õ°¬∞ Õú ñ Õ°¬∞)). This game is great for everyone who likes GTA but with less logic (none), playing as a goat and just loving to make chaos all around you. On top of that, if you are really bored (like really) you can collect all the achievements (yes I did that, because I was really bored). The dlcs are ridiculously well made, espiacally Waste of Space and the Payday dlc. Theres also one DAY Z like dlc that is also cool and a MMO dlc, that you even get for free if you just get the regular game. I am noticing that I've been writing this review for more than a minute now. What am I doing with my life? I need to find work. I should look for it instead of doing this crap. Can you even say crap here? Whatever, the game is actually really good and fun in the possibly most stupid, weirdest and most ridiculous way. Definitely recommend it. Pour peu qu'on mette de c√¥t√© les quelques bugs et les temps d'attente parfois longuets pour trouver une partie, qui entament par moment le plaisir de jeu, Dead by Daylight est une exp√©rience multijoueur rafra√Æchissante et un v√©ritable gouffre √† temps libre.S'il √©tait besoin de le rappeler, le titre propose un gameplay asym√©trique permettant d'incarner, au choix, un tueur surpuissant, assoiff√© de massacre, mais seul ou un survivant fr√™le, d√©sireux de fuir, mais pouvant compter sur ses trois co-√©quipiers pour esp√©rer l'emporter. Stanley errait sur Steam lorsqu'il tomba sur la page du magasin d'un jeu au titre curieusement √©vocateur.Il se mit √† lire, parmi d'autres, la critique d'un utilisateur nomm√© "SuperJailRocks" et d√©cida que c'√©tait un pseudo parfaitement ridicule et absurde.En revanche, Stanley trouva que la critique en elle-m√™me √©tait excellente, pour ne pas dire brillante et pointue, et il d√©cida non seulement d'acheter le jeu mais aussi d'√©valuer positivement la critique de l'utilisateur au pseudo d√©bile. J'ai enfin test√© et termin√©, des ann√©es apr√®s sa sortie (en 2005), Psychonauts de Tim Schafer et son √©quipe. Je lorgnais sur le titre de longue date, parce que je raffole de l'oeuvre du bonhomme lorsqu'il officiait chez LucasArts, et j'ai retrouv√©, dans Psychonauts, une partie de l'humour d√©cal√© et de l'imagination foisonnante qui l'habitaient durant ces ann√©es. La patte artistique aussi, qui donne une vraie personnalit√© au jeu.En revanche, le gameplay et les contr√¥les, pourtant essentiels dans un jeu de plates-formes/action-aventure, m'ont sembl√© mal ma√Ætris√©s (la faute √† l'√©coulement du temps peut-√™tre?) et je n'ai √©t√© que tr√®s moyennement convaincu par le rythme global de l'aventure. With 4 hours of playtime I think I can make an honest review of the game. PROS So to start off with the pros I think the game has lot of potential to become a great game that is fun to play. I like the idea of having a ghost hunting game where your goal is to hunt the ghosts and get em before a specific time and as the ghosts then you can troll the ghost hunters with lots of abilities. As a ghost hunter the weaponry and equipment is quite good for what I can tell at a glance but I cannot go into details on which weapons are too op and which are too bad to use and the same goes for perks. The same goes for the ghosts in this regard but I like the unique abilities both teams have. The maps are decent and need to be learned to become better at finding hiding spots or finding the ghosts which is good. The whole concept and the ways to play are fun and it is enjoyable every time you get someone because of an ability. CONS The match making is my biggest concern here since I'm only level 8 and I've been matched up against players at level 53 and they just completely obliterated me without a sweat and that kills the experience for me personally. I think the game needs a system to balance out players and even just having a simple system that makes some sort of balance would be great to have. The servers are also only on client side and there are no servers to connect to so you are connecting to a host player that might destroy your ping and also how fast stuff is getting executed and that is not a great thing in games that are based on PvP 4v4 style play. Personally I feel like the ghost attacks are quite weak and hard to use and they maybe need a strike attack they can use with a high cooldown that does a small amount of damage. Right now you have to rely on hitting your target by being a prop otherwise you will have to punch them but that makes you vulnerable to attacks and you die pretty easily. I get that the ghosts are the hiders but their defense is quite weak if they wanna play aggressively and strike the hunters.Overall on a scale from 1 to 10 I'll give Midnight Ghost Hunt in it's current state...7 / 10 - üåïüåïüåïüåóüåë

I've never played Halo before so this review is in the eyes of a new player into the franchise PROS To begin with I think the maps looks amazing and I love this whole futuristic style war between 2 teams. My favorite gamemode there is currently in the game is definetly 12v12 which is so fun and random stuff happen all the time, that gamemode kept me entertained for hours. The game is free and the content you get currently for that price is amazing and fun. The other gamemodes are also fun to play but personally I prefer the 12v12. I've played a mix of games and all gamemodes kept me entertained for a long time. CONS The game has not have any new content in form of weapons, maps or vehicles so I feel like the game is at a standstill currently with no new stuff introduced. Many Halo fans has talked about community made gamemodes like infection which would be fun to play after looking it up. I wish the developers would add more content other than customization stuff.Overall on a scale from 1 to 10 I'll give Halo Infinite in it's current state...7 / 10 - üåïüåïüåïüåóüåë

Scary the first hour you play it and then it gets annoying and competitive because you try to win the game. The first map is the only fun map in the game and the others are just annoying to play. Can't recommend unless you are searching for 1 hour of entertainment and then call it a day!My review on Pacify after playing with friends. PROS The atmosphere is great and terrifying especially in the first map in the game and that is well made. Another great thing are the jumpscares and the whole objective fits the game where you have to escape the monster in order to complete the objectives and getting stuck in a place is also really terrifying when you are getting hunted. CONS Scary the first hour you play it and then it gets annoying and competitive because you try to win the game after that. The first map is the only map in the game that is fun to play and the others can be annoying to play. The other maps make me feel annoyed after the objectives are annoying to complete and that ruins the horror experience alot. The price is decent but I wish more content would be added and changes would be made so there would be more content to enjoy for your money.Overall on a scale from 1 to 10 I'll give Pacify in it's current state...3 / 10 - üåïüåóüåëüåëüåë
Amazing game!Great graphics and good gameplay with fun combat mechanics. I definetly recommend this game if you are looking for a great MMORPG to play.

Really great game with lots of luck and skill combined. I like the random map layouts every time you play to make it more fun since you will not meet the same map twice. The atmosphere in the game is really well done as well. Overall I really enjoy the game.9 / 10

I've not played a lot but have tried it out so this review might update! PROS I think the game is great and I love how the feel is of the houses and also how you use the equipment. The steps for exorcisms are easy to do as it's just placing some exorcism items in the ghost room with no other steps other than just dropping them. I love how easy this is but maybe on a higher difficulty this could change to make it more difficult. The amount of interactions the ghost can do really stuns me since there's almost a new thing i see every hunt that I didn't before which is amazing. The whole system about the ghost being a shadow is awesome as well and the only way to show the ghost model is by guessing (either wrong or correct) and if you're wrong then the ghost gets more aggressive as I've experienced. CONS The cons are there are game breaking bugs right now that can break the game so you have to quit to the main menu since you can't use the radio or pick up equipment. This happens randomly and also sometimes when you start a game. The XP system is weird as I've only recieved 50 XP and that was not even on my 2 completed runs. The controls are not changeable which can be annoying at times since I miss click some of the time.Overall on a scale from 1 to 10 I'll give Obsideo in it's current state... 7 / 10

What a great and innovative way to play chess. I like the ways you destroy other pieces it looks really great combined with the amazing sound effects it makes when you crush enemies and next wave comes into play. If you are a fan of chess or have just played it for fun then i really recommend this game. I also think it is a great way to think differently and also practice some strategy in the real game.

I think it's the best pay to win game i've played and i generally don't like those types of games due to balance. Lords Mobile is a game where smaller people (like me) who are free to play can still thrive and have fun destroying other people. I get that you can't participate in the higher ranking of players where they are pay to win only but you can still do lots of stuff in the smaller leagues as well. Overall i think the game is fun regarding of it being pay to win it's just about strategy and playing smarter than the big guys.

Such a cool game! I like that it is a horror game mixed with detective work where you have to find clues and point out which type of ghost haunts a place. If you're someone who are facinated by paranormal activity then i highly recommend this game!9 / 10

Halo Infinite is the 6th instalment in the Master Chief series, after 6 long years 343 and brought back Chief for a whole new story. After delays and setbacks, Halo Infinite isn't the most polished title of them all nor does the optimisation really work in anyone's favour, but it still has tons of hours of fun.PROS: -  The campaign and story feels unique and well written with tons of jaw dropping moments and badass scenes-  Multiplayer feels back to the good old days of fast TTK with a whole new range of weapons.-  Campaign feels like an open sandbox of Halo CE, bringing many fond moments of childhood-  Multiplayer has a good but fixable customisation systemCONS:- ‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô• battle pass (F2P can't complain, but i will)- Poor optimisation, 35 fps on low settings with an RX 6600... but a 1060 can push 50/60...- NO SWAT!!!!- Some weapons are OP, some are ‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•

A very funny but hard game to play. It has proximity chat (where you need to get close to let people near you hear you) and the game has multiple big servers for you to play on. So I would definitely recommend this to all of you people that like mid 19th century Napoleonic Era.

This is a really good game made by HI-Rez compared to Paladins. Au vu de sa vitesse et du d√©calage anachronique, c'est un peu comme jouer avec les codes de triche, mais √ßa reste cool.

Pas besoin de plusieurs heures pour donner un avis concret sur Days Of War. Ce jeu est totalement inint√©ressant et vide. Il n'a d'√©gal que le comportement perfide des joueurs qui en peuplent les serveurs.  Lors de mon test, je pensais que ce jeu venait de sortir, que c'√©tait nouveau, et que donc, nous √©tions dans de l'EA. Mais dej√†, on en voyait les limites. Alors, constater que ce jeu est en vente depuis 2017, mais, qu'en plus, l'EA est termin√©, √ßa me suffit amplement.Il est assez difficile de juger ce type de jeu, car la concurrence est rude. Pour vous donner un exemple, Day Of Infamy est sorti dans la m√™me p√©riode, et tout comme ce jeu, il √©tait l√©g√®rement chaotique et assez instable au lancement. Mais les d√©veloppeurs ont travaill√© dessus, ils ont chang√© des choses, rectifi√© les petits soucis et bugs. Dans le cas de Day Of War, c'est comme si rien n'avait √©t√© fait.D√©j√† parce qu'il manque des choses √©videntes ; la possibilit√© de se pencher en restant a couvert. Ca parait peut-√™tre mineur, mais √ßa manque beaucoup dans un FPS de ce type ou la pr√©cision est de mise. On rajoute √† √ßa des cartes qui sont belles mais d√©s√©quilibr√©es & mal pens√©es. Tellement mal, qu'il ne suffit que de quelques parties pour " choper " les endroits ou se cacher. Une faille qui attire une certaines communaut√©, les joueurs malhonn√™te. En effet, si vous aimez profiter des zones de transparence, des petits bugs de map et des endroits camouflage, je vous recommande ce jeu. Attention cependant, car la concurrence est rude pour trouver son emplacement de camping.Donc, l'on a un jeu beau, qui tourne tr√®s bien, le tout avec un communaut√© qui ruine le jeu, d√©j√† qu'il est difficile de lui trouver des points fort ... L'on rajoute √† √ßa les probl√®mes avec le filtrage audio. J'ai horreur de jouer et d'entendre un autre joueur qui commente tout en enregistrant le bruit lamentable de son clavier juste parce que ce dernier veut parler en jouant mais n'est pas assez √©duqu√© pour s'acheter un micro de chat ( Astuce : Ca peut se trouver a moins de 5‚Ç?chez Action ).Le probl√®me se pose car l'on ne peut que partiellement muter le canal VOIP, des fois on entend les joueurs parler malgr√®s le filtre, et sist√©matiquement, on entend tout le monde parler √† la fin de la manche et durant les √©crans de chargement. Entre les bruits de mecs qui gueulent, les autres qui tapent sur leur clavier et l'ordi portable packard bell qui fait un brut de r√©acteur de fus√©e, le mal de cr√¢ne est garanti ...En r√©sum√©, il m'a suffit de tr√®s peu de temps de jeu pour constater la m√©diocrit√© de ce jeu, je ne vois m√™me pas pourquoi je devrais lui donner une seconde chance, Day Of Infamy est bien mieux, il y'a une communaut√© respectueuse et plus grande, et le comble dans tout √ßa ? Il co√ªte moins cher.

Je me laisse surprendre par un jeu PVP qui semble int√©ressant. Le test est rapide puisque le jeu p√®se √† peine 3 Gb. Apr√®s un test d'une trentaine de minutes, je pense pouvoir vous le recommander puisque gratuit.Actuellement, seul le mode deathmatch est disponible √† l'essai. Pas de mode histoire, a mon avis, on est plus pr√®s d'une alpha que d'une b√©ta, du moins en se basant sur cet √©chantillon.https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=CeFG1yYzd7M&feature=youtu.beAmbiance assez marrante dans les serveurs, le jeu vient d'√™tre lanc√©, et pour beaucoup, ce sont nos premi√®res parties. Apr√®s avoir effectu√© un didacticiel obligatoire qui est simple et pratique, l'on a la possibilit√© d'acc√©der au multijoueur. Vous incarnez un robot volant, c'est un peu le " Jack " du groupe Gears Of War. Toute l'utilit√© de ce type de jeu est dans la prise de l'altitude et la possibilit√© d'obtenir un visuel en temps r√©el de la situation et de la strat√©gie √† appliquer. Vous dirigez une escouade que vous pouvez guider avec le clic droit. en multijoueur, les escouades sont compos√© de 3 soldats IA ( pour un capsule volante, ou un robot ) qui est contr√¥l√© par le joueur.C'est assez marrant et le mode de jeu est amusant. Par contre, je trouve √ßa assez moche, le d√©cors est partiellement flou par moment, je trouve que √ßa donne vite le tournis pour un jeu de 2020.A voir, mais pour ce test, √ßa ne co√ªte rien de tester.

Re√ßu par hasard dans nos propositions, le jeu Lonely Mountain a beaucoup retenu notre attention. Du fait de sa petite taille, il a √©t√© tr√®s rapide de t√©l√©charger le jeu, √† peine moins de  500 mb. Et que penser de ce jeu ? Il est excellent.Le Die and Retry, un type de jeu assez frustrant qui revient en force depuis quelques ann√©es. On peut penser aux plus c√©l√®bres de la d√©cennie, Hotline Miami, Super Meat Boy ou encore SuperHot. C'est un principe assez simple, le tout pour un jeu limit√© : vous devez effectuer une action, atteindre un endroit sous une limite de temps ou encore rester en vie durant l'accomplissement de l'objectif. Ainsi, la dur√©e de temps que vous pouvez passer sur ce type de jeu est extr√©mement variable, ce temps pouvant passer du double au triple. Au fil du jeu, et √† mesure que votre connaissance se paufine, vos reflex s'am√©liorent jusqu'√† triompher du jeu. Ce m√©canisme est l'objectif recherch√©. Il est mis en place par les d√©veloppeurs, et les joueurs l'ex√©cutent apr√®s avoir √©tudi√© le niveau.Le probl√®me dans ce type de jeu, c'est que c'est assez compliqu√© √† faire. C'est pourquoi beaucoup de jeux ind√© sortent chaque ann√©e, mais demeurent des √©checs. Je pense principalement √† l'√©chec de Season's Beating, ou encore Riskers, qui, pourtant, auraient pu √™tre de bon jeux. Le principal de ces jeux a √©t√© le manque de qualification pour le mapping. Des jeux comme Super Hot laissent une petite fen√™tre d'espoir, malgr√© un d√©c√®s, tandis que ces autres jeux √©taient tout simplement frustrant. Concernant ce jeu, vous descendez une pente abrupte avec des obstacles √† la clef, ou encore pire, des ravins. Il faut doser entre l'acc√©l√©rateur et le freinage, g√©rer entre l'envie de battre un score, ou l'intention d'arriver avec le moins de " crash " possible. Apr√®s une premi√®re pente, et environs 7 checkpoints de pass√©, l'on vous propose de refaire cette piste avec des objectifs en plus. A chaque checkpoint, le temps est mis entre parenth√®se. Il y'a un temps auquel vous avez pass√© le checkpoint, et un temps qui dit combien de temps vous allez passer entre le premier et le deuxi√®me checkpoint. Si vous chuter, ce temps revient √† celui ou vous √©tiez en passant le premier checkpoint.Il faut bien prendre en compte l'absorption des chocs, qui fait que vous ne pouvez pas supporter des sauts sur une grande hauteur, ce qui colle avec le r√©alisme de ce sport √† sensation. Des VTT plus r√©sistant avec des sp√©cialisations se d√©bloquent en accomplissant les d√©fis du jeu.Je ne pense que le prix de 19.99 soit correct pour un tel jeu, je ne le commercialiserai pas au-dessus de 9.99‚Ç? mais le d√©veloppeur a quand-m√™me pass√© plusieurs ann√©es dessus avec un crowfunding kickstarter.

Kane And Lynch est un jeu qui a beaucoup de mal √† plaire, et pour cause ...Ca ne peut effectivement pas plaire √† tout le monde, on le sent d√®s les premi√®res minutes de gameplay. Le jeu se pr√©sente plut√¥t comme un film, ou du moins, il se joue " comme ". Cam√©ra √† l'√©paule, plans risqu√© mais beau,ou des fois m√™me tout simplement foireux. Sauf que l'on ne peut pas jouer √† un jeu comme l'on regarde un film. Lynch est probablement le personnage, derri√®re un homme adorable et dou√© de sensibilit√© se cache un sociopathe antipathique. C'est assez bien expliqu√© dans le premier opus : il y'a deux hommes qui sommeillent en lui. Honn√™tement, je me demande m√™me si son personnage n'a pas inspir√© notre c√©l√®bre Trevor, repr√©sent√© par Steven Ogg. Il y'a m√™me une ressemblance physique assez importante.L'ancien homme tente d√©sesperemant de mettre son pass√© d'homme derri√®re lui. C'√©tait sans compter sur le lot de soucis de Kane va lui apporter en implorant son aide. A savoir que les deux homme se sont rencontr√© dans le premier opus, Kane √©tant le Liam Nison √† la recherche de sa fille kidnapp√©, et Lynch l'homme de main des kidnappeurs. Les deux vont malgr√© eux une confiance r√©ciproque.Ce jeu nous ram√®ne dans les rues bond√©es de l'Asie moderne. De trahisons en pis, les deux personnages se retrouvent traqu√© par une arm√©e enti√®re aux trousses. Ce qu'est int√©ressant dans ce jeu mais qui est explique qu'il peut √™tre un peu d√©routant : la cam√©ra √† la 3 personnes. Comme dit plus haut, on parle de prise √† l'√©paule ou √† la hanche, ce qui explique les tremblements fr√©quents et les balances al√©atoire de focus. Une partie des lumi√®re de la ville peut m√™me √™tre occult√© par les lumi√®res des nombreux √©crans publicitaires. La mani√®re de vivre ce jeu ressemble √† un m√©lange entre le cin√©ma de Oliver Stone et de John Woo. Evidemment, on compare avec les films comparables, notamment Tueur n√© et Volte Face.Le manque d'histoire est totalement assum√©, on ne sait pas ou ils vont, on ne comprend ni le d√©but ni la fin : le but, c'est survivre. Tr√®s bon atout sur lequel je trouve important d'insister, vous pouvez jouer au jeu en coop, chacun sur votre PC. Ainsi, il est possible de faire la campagne aupr√®s d'un ami. C'est vraiment tr√®s sympa. Il est difficile de trouver du monde sur un jeu aussi vieux, mais √ßa peut arriver !En conclusion un jeu quand-m√™me potable. Il est √† la hauteur de son prix sur les p√©riodes de soldes, puisqu'il avoisine les 2‚Ç? C'est un jeu que je recommande en coop.

Armored Kitten est probablement l'un des jeux qui est le plus en phase avec son prix de vente hors p√©riode de soldes.Cependant, le jeu conviendrait peut-√™tre mieux aux joueurs de portable, dans la cat√©gorie " reflex ". Un shoot 'em up assez standard avec une certaine dose de laisser-aller. Au fil de la progression dans les objectifs, il est possible d'am√©liorer son armure et ses armes. Evidemment, a un certain niveau de jeu, il devient indispensable d'investir cet argent fictif dans des am√©liorations.https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=1891972803L'on pourrait regretter le manque d'animations des personnages et l'absence totale de contexte. On ne demande pas une histoire digne d'un jeu Rockstar, mais au moins un peu d'immersion. Des objectifs plus ou moins similaire.Je pensais jouer ce jeu √† la manette, et bien que le support soit totalement disponible avec le controller Xbox One, je joue finalement bien mieux via un clavier.Pour le prix, c'est correct. J'estime le temps entre 1 et 2 h.

This is my second Wolfenstein game that I finished thus far and I have to say I enjoyed this game immensely, really fast-paced and satisfying gunplay and difficulty that manages to keep you on your toes. It was a breath of fresh air seeing enemies actually hide when you shot them instead of rushing at you like they wanted a death wish, I was taken aback how precise and accurate the AI can be at times. The story is decent but nothing to write home about, visually speaking the game is rough around the edges but the gameplay is undoubtedly top notch. Case in point, this game f****** rules.

Ein lustiges Spiel! Man macht Missionen oder Optionale Missionen bevor man sich der Hauptmission widmet. Atmosph√§risch mit interessanter Story.Sch√∂ne Grafik mit tollen m√∂glichkeiten sich in die dort lebenden Tiere zu verwandeln.Alles erkunden, sammeln und Spa√ü haben.Wer etwas ruhiges und sch√∂nes spielen will, dem empfehle ich dieses Spiel ^^

Immer wieder sch√∂n, von diesen Entwicklern ein Spiel zu spielen. Ich hoffe sehr da kommt noch mehr, zumal es am Ende von diesem Teil den anschein hat, als w√ºrde da noch was kommen.Diese Spiele lohnen sich sowasvon. Die Story, die Charaktere, haupts√§chlich die beiden Hauptfiguren, einfach wundervoll. Humor und dabei diese eig sehr traurigen und dramatischen Geschichten. Immer wieder toll, wie viel Liebe in sowas stecken kann.Kann ich nur empfehlen.

Also ich hab es zwar bisher nur kurz angespielt, bin aber echt begeistert von dem bisschen was ich so gesehen habe. Man kann so viel anfassen!! So vieles, eig sogar fast alles bis auf wenige kleinigkeiten bewegen und anfummeln, das ich echt beeindruckt bin. Selten ein Spiel gehabt, wo man echt so viel anfassen konnte xDAuch die Atmosph√§re, die Musik, die wenige Story die ich bisher gesehen habe, alles in einem sehr interessant und gelungen.Ich bin schon ein kleiner Horrorfan und bei diesem Spiel schmelze ich dahin, weil es mich wirklich fesselt. Das erreichen wenige Horrorspiele. Leider brauch es √∂fters l√§nger beim laden, da kann ich aber nicht sagen ob es an mir liegt oder generell am Spiel. Mich st√∂rt es nicht, es ist nur etwas st√∂rend wenn man sich grad auf das Spiel einl√§sst und dann l√§dt der erstmal 10 min bis zum n√§chsten Kapitel. Ansonsten kann ich das Spiel nur w√§rmstens empfehlen, an alle die Horror lieben!Sch√∂ne Grafik, finde ich zumindest und ich bin mal gespannt wie es weitergeht.

Only just realised on my 2nd full playthrough that I should leave a review to say how ‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô?awesome this game is. No matter if you played MGS 1, 2 ,3 , etc or if you only play FPS' this game is for you, there's a giant twisting ‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô?story that I've managed to follow (mostly) for more seasoned followers of the franchise; it helps that I used to play MGS 2 and 3 continuously.This time the stealth is much more lenient and there is more focus on action which gets sort of annoying at times but for a more authentic experience simply lower the brightness and turn reflex mode off: this is how I reccomend playing this game if you're not a ‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•' ‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô? When you get bored of sneaking around like some sort of mole-rat you can always don some battle armour and storm the gates of a heavily guarded outpost with an assortment of weapons such as LMGS, launchers,  grenades, assault rifles (which all have non-lethal alternatives if you want to do a swat-style raid) leaving no man alive in your devastating wake all while "REBEL YELLLLLL" plays from your 1980s custom cassete mixtape (that you stole from earlier outposts).The story gets progressively more interesting at the cost of also becoming progressively more confusing. The supernatural aspects of the story felt somewhat forced in my opinion since these moments are no doubt juxtaposed, by me and other players of older games of the franchise, with the hyperrealistic details and aspects of the old games: smoking ciggerettes make laser sensors visible, and carboard boxes break in the rain...But in TPP magical grey aliens exist and can throw giant rocks...eh it's aight I guess.Yeah just get it seriously, 25 quid is a ‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô?deal considering I spent about ¬£75 on this but I don't regret it, it's already gave me over 110 hours (including console hours) of enjoyment and has got me to change my phone wallpaper to the Diamond Dogs logo because kojima is a direct blood reletive to one of his probable various oriental gods and this is the last we will (truly) see of his beautiful masterpeice that is the Metal Gear franchise.
Such an underrated game. Got it on ‚ô•‚ô•‚ô?for ¬£3.25. If you have that money laying around, (which of course you do), get it.
