I liked the 2nd part more, but mostly because the image thing didn't really work for me. I sinply didn't feel anything or wasn't able to interpret my feelings + I'm visually impaired (almost blind) + I've become emotionaly numb over the past 8 years. So it's either one of those or a combination of those reason why I didn't enjoy it as much. But the game is still worth while.Thankfully that discontinued the use of the horrible font used in the 2nd part of the trilogy.Secret words1: Love2: Selfcare3:CompassionTRIGGER WARNINGdon't read on if you easily get disturbed by topics like depression and suicide.YOU DON'T HAVE TO WORRY ABOUT MEI'M IN THERAPY 4 TIMES A WEEK.I'm just puking out my thoughts after playing the trilogy and trying to verbalize my feelings. If you're intrested in messy minds feel free to read on but it doesn't have anything to do with a "review"I haven't cried since I was 14, I'm 22 now.I played the trilogy in a binge session and wasn''t phased by anything in it untill the end of the third game (this one). Tears started rolling at the end of this chapter cause' I realized that I'm not really "living". I've been suicidal for almost a decade. The game didn't change that, at least not yet. But it started an important thought process and made me, well realize is not the right word since I already knew what the game told me, it rather made me remeber it again.I haven't been living life for me, I just keep on because of my mother who became blind a few years ago. And don't want to leave her in a situation like this and help her as much as I can with the little eyesight I was born with. I really don't know what makes her keep on going cuase' definitely kill myself if I'd lose the little eyesight I have. And she lost way more, since she was able to see perfectly fine.I also didn't inherit my ‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô• eyes from my mother. My half-brother has no disabilities at all.She lost one eye ages ago after getting hit by a drunk driver (she was not in a car).She was in the hospital for months because basicly half of her bones were broken and the retina of her right eye got disconnected from her optic nerve. And the retina in her left eye started to losen up but she was still able to see quite well (~80% of regular eyesight).Then 20 years later it slowly started to losen up more all of a sudden. The doctors told her that she'll probably have ~5-7 years from now onm till she'll turn blind and recommended her to get some eye surgery done before it's too late. My mom trusted the "professional" and agreed to the surgery. Well what can I say, they totally f**ked up and turned her blind istantly instead of letting her enjoy her eyeseight for a few more years.Now my eyesight started degrating too. Thankfully it's a really slow process and my case is very complicated so there is no way to fix my eyes with any kind of surgery. I really love my mother, she allways did her best to make my life as great as possible. I really appreciate that since I seen many bad examples from other students in my school and friends.I really hope I become blind after my mother passes away. If my eyes kick the bucket before she passes away it'll be the hardest decision I'll ever have to make. Since I basicly already chose to end myself if become blind. If my mother wouldn't have had that accident and therefore wouldn't have any problems with her eyes I'd probably be dead already.I know that I'll hurt many people by chosing death but I simply can't live just for other peoples' sakes. I'm fine with beeing an ‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô? I'd rather have my friends hate me rather than missing me.That way it'll be easier for them to forget me.My mom is a special case, cause like I said thanks to her I always had everything I needed. She was always there me.But what I'm doing right now can't be called "living".I have no goals in life and can't make up any cause' I simply don't care.I dropped all of my hobbies over time and can't bring myself to do them anymore even though I very much enjoyed them ages ago.So all I do currenty is:Help my mother with her daily(Shopping, cooking, paperwork)Attend my apprenticeship in the IT branch to earn money.I sometimes meet friends, if they have.At home I usually procrastinate and mindlessly watch YouTube or Netflix etc.I have to write monthly reports wich I have to submit when I want to attend the Exams.I'm four months behind and can't get my ass up to write them, instead I waste my energy on writing this wall of text.I'm in sort of an autopilot mode, my memory is so broken I can't even rember what happened a few days ago. I simply don't pay attention to anything anymore because I just want life to get over with.Days seem past me really quicly but at the same time it feels like an eternity till I can finally rest.I don't know if this game will bring back my will to live and I don't expect it to do so.However this game stirred up some emotions in me. This is quite an acomplishmed considering my emotional numbness in the past 8 years.The only time I actually feel clearly distinguishable emotion is when I enter manic episodes due to my bipolar disorder. But during those episodes I'm the only one who has fun and enjoys it because my Friends an Family eventually get hurt by my manic behavior.So I take medications that are supposed to stabilize my mood, however since I know how good the manic phases feel everything bellow that level just feels dull.It's the same pricipal with you can't miss it if you don't know it.When a person is born bild in the first place the chance is way higher that the person is fine with it and adopts well to the disability. On the other hand if you know what it's like to see losing that ability hits way harder. Same goes for the manic episodes.I tested a lot of   d r u 6 $ and none of them even remotely rech the "high" of a manic episode.I have no conclusion yet, I'd really want to end it before I lose all my eyesight, since tying a noose isn't that easy when just lost your eyesight.For now I'll simply continue my monotone zombie life since I don't know what to do about it and lack the energy to find out.Thank you for publishing this game series.I wish everyone a great day and hope you didn't get depressed nor confused from my giant thoughts puke

Enemies getting glitched and annoying the heck out of everything around. Im not sure if the fullings are meant to be that powerful? Maybe tone the amount of damage they do down a little bit? The sea serpents spawning bugged for us, so now none will spawn, whereas we would see 4 every single in game day, previously. Those are really my only complaints tbh. I will say keep up the amazing work guys and I am seriously looking forward to the new and exciting content! :)

What can i say another classic in the warhammer series. I have to come off the bat to say its a 9/10 the one big side down to this is that there isn't really a campaign to this game. Its just a overall a original battle front 2 galatic conquest at its basics. Although its very similar to Warhammer Dawn of War Game of the year edition it has a few more factions including a advance robot faction and the big scary green guys on the cover. The game play isn't bad at all often being very fun capturing and holding new lands that give requsition and other little bonuses such as attack movement and the amazing honor guards that you spawn in with in each new battle. What i do like to see that if capture and hold a area what ever defenses you last left there is still there to work with. One down side of this is you cant capture the whole map if you do what ever that spawns in spawns on your HQ in that one are and destroys everything if you're not fast enough to train units and stop them. Over all this game is great for a cheap price and i recommend playing it with some friends to do some battles.

This is one of the most fun RTS games i have ever played. Brought hours of fun with multiple factions to play with dynamic unit selection. Has a strong campaign and a fun story line. One of the few story lines i actually get invested into cause it actually pulled me in. It has a bottom line of being unique and a original game. You can create massive battles with elite units or just have a swarm of weak and watch them battle it. Also allowing the units have multiple other weapons equiped too also makes them even more dynamic also allowing some faction spawn some of their own bosses like the Eldar's fire god and the Chao's Demon. This is a overall a 10/10 game for me i have no problem with it and its hours of fun for a cheap price.

Cry of fear where could i even begin? This game is a master piece. The story the monsters everything keeps you on your toes the animations them selves are a work of art. This was one of the scariest horror games I ever played so scary halfway through I had to take a 2 month break of the game because of how much the game made me feel on my toes. The game threw so many unique and challenging monsters and bosses in such different ways twards you and having multiple endings due to a action from you speaks volumes in a horror game. I can respect the people you put all their time into making this and still make it a free game.

Dude simulator where can i start. It's a overall 2 out of 5 stars. He has multiple of the same game publish like updated versions of it and still making you pay money for these updated games other then updating this game and making it better. He has so little effort in this game its sad. When i started it, it was actually decent the looks and graphics of the game i really liked. But when it comes to the NPC's the hitboxs to them and the overall game in it self just dived into just horrible nonsense. The NPC's often ran in a straight line to you making them easy targets and making them all spawned in one area lagged the game and make many of them die instantly from tripping over one of another. You could get in a car and be instantly invincible watching the cops trying to get you and just dying from a stopped car. The game is do what ever you want which is basically just drive around, kill people, walk, or just buying items from horribly decorated stores and filled with just a few items each.I honestly believe this guy just made this game for the cash and nothing else so little work was put into this game. If it was a free game i would of accepted it and liked it knowing they probably just did this for the players enjoyment and trying hard to learn by making video games while making us the player know that,  other then just trying to take our money. If it was free i would give this game a positive review but the lack of effort the horrible making of it the crappy one liner dialogue for the characters and having no story and crappy NPC's it looks like he just made this in a single day. If you ever wish to talk to a RANDOM NPC you just talked them and say one of THREE things. 1 Hi2 Follow3 StayThats it. The horrible purchasing mechanic of weapons is that you need to repurchase a weapon for its ammo. Hey want 4 clips? Well you need to pay a extra 100$ for a new gun thats even empty. You can't stack you have to wait to empty the gun out to get more ammo unless you're just wasting money. Even getting and earning cash in this game is sad. Kill civilians to get 1-10$ each. Or if you really wish look for a spawn point collect the cash (since a lot of them tripped and died) or just get in a car and get a wanted level and just walk away for 3 minutes come back, die and collect all the cash which takes way to long to pick up, picking each one up individually is annoying to say the least. There is more to say but i'm done on this horrible title.

Heh for a dollar it's not that bad. Yes i know there is tons of glitches, But this game doesntreally reach for the horror aspect for me it's more then funny then anything to me. The AI is one of the dumbest things i ever seen in my life, I glitch through walls and the games some times crash, The horror feel to it comes due to it's bad setting, Like and old game and thats sometimes i really like in this game. Just don't buy the game if you expected horror it is just a dollar afterall and i give the team some congrats for a decent/‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô• game.

Thank god this game is free and it's still in its beta phase... When you start off to say the least you're weak compaired to all the other players, You have a crappy smg that you need 5 head shots to kill 1 person and while the more experianced players have guns that does around 1999 damage, and yes that is true, It's basically dead only needing 1 server, You need to pay money for skins that you might have  a probably have a chance of getting, Its a borderline gambling system taking away your US dollars, God for bid to think that you get 2 of the same skin.. I never gave a negative review but this game is just horrible and i've seen real crap in my days.
I locked my door for a reason. And now my chair is white thanks!. Will play again soon if internet is out.

ENG: BLOCKPOST is a mixture of Minecraft and Counter Strike: Global Offensive, the game is made in a cubic style, like most similar games in this genre.In this game you will find a lot of donation, which to some extent affects the gameplay, but weapons can also be knocked out of chests after completing certain tasks, and increasing the account level.The gameplay in the game is very dynamic, you will not have time to get bored. Also in the game there is a very wide variety of weapons, you can play as a sniper, hiding behind some cover, and as an attack aircraft who will fight off the captured territory.Another disadvantage of the game is cheaters, there are more of them than you think, the developers are not trying to do anything about it.Let's get down to the pluses of this creation:- Dynamic battles.- Having even hands, you can do without donation and knock out all the weapons without problems.- Optimization- Creative mod, in which you can create a map with your chips and then start a server for players and your friends.- Many modes will not let you get bored.- FreeToPlay game.Now to the cons:- Donut, which gives you an advantage in weapons.- Cheaters, in this game you will meet quite a few of them.- Very rare events and updates.- Mediocre graphics, there are several analogues that are 99.9% identical- There is no way to ban / kick cheaters from the server.- Lack of anti-cheat.RUS:BLOCKPOST - ENG: It's a love hate relationship with Hearts of Iron. Paradox as of now make some of the better grand strategy games on the market, but their DLC policy is nothing short of greedy evil gremlins. This will turn into a $200+ game to get access to the "full" experience. It seems for single player they shifted focus on optimization and refinement of game mechanics, to flashy alt history and even more broken mechanics. I bought this game when it just came out of beta and there are still bugs from 4 years ago. Paradox thinks that people will shrug off poor mechanics in favor for new exciting DLC and right now they are right. Until people stop supporting such crude marketing (myself included) they will milk us dry before they fix their game. ENG: The plot in this game is so simple that it is, in principle, not needed here. In the world of Trove, everything was happy and calm while the Sun Goddess ruled, but at one point the Moon Goddess did not like such things, and since then an endless battle of light and darkness began. End. Moreover, additional information cannot be obtained, since there are no informational quests in the game.To play with a new class, there is no need to create a new character, this game will not let you do it anyway. It is enough to click on the desired interface button, and your hero is already a proud carrier of another class. At the very beginning, after completing the training, the player will be given the opportunity to receive one additional class for free. However, further to unlock new ones, you will need to either farm reagents for special crafting, or donate, if you are too lazy to waste time.Trove has a lot to do. The main focus of the game is on the grind. In fact, since this is a sandbox, each player determines the main goal for himself in his own way. For some, the goal will be to collect the maximum number of skins for their character, someone will want to get all mounts, and someone will want to pump all classes to the maximum level and get the coolest equipment at the moment.The maximum level of each class in the game is 30th. But beyond that, there is the so-called mastery level, which is capped at 700. Also, for a visual display of the effectiveness of the character, there is a Power Rank, which shows how cool your character is and is able to unwind enemies in different directions.This is a cubic MMO, where you can also mine cubic blocks, and then build whatever comes to mind from them. In Trove, this is realized both in customizing your own houses, and in creating separate worlds within your club. You can create a separate, isolated club world where you can invite other people and arrange your instances, and so on. In all these worlds, the lives of local players pass.RUS: –°—é–∂–µ—Ç –≤ —ç—Ç–æ–π –∏–≥—Ä–µ –Ω–µ–∑–∞–º—ã—Å–ª–æ–≤–∞—Ç –Ω–∞—Å—Ç–æ–ª—å–∫–æ, —á—Ç–æ –æ–Ω —Ç—É—Ç –≤ –ø—Ä–∏–Ω—Ü–∏–ø–µ –∏ –Ω–µ –Ω—É–∂–µ–Ω. –í I have laid my eyes upon God, and he was weeping.1DAY is living proof that we've been abandoned by our divine creator. Humanity is destined to spiral the drain of destruction  until we are--inevitably--sucked down into its frigid depths. How can a species like ours--who has created countless artworks, wisdoms, and technological advancements--make something as disheartening and abhorrent as this?I don't know, my friends; I just don't know.I can farm this ‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô• for cards though; that's pretty ‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô?sweet.
The game--without any xpacks--has almost as much depth as Civ 5--with all the xpacks. With a little tinkering on Firaxis' part, I could easily see this being the best Civ game to ever exist.

I really want to like this, really I do, but I can't. The gameplay is way too simplistic, you walk left and right through corridor after corridor, each lined with repeating art assets. I found that every attempt to unnerve me was either too dull or too heavy-handed. Also, this, "Thomas," guy literally can't run for more than ten to twelve seconds. I paid three dollars for this game, an amount I suppose is fair. But the base price of fifteen dollars? I don't think so.
CONSThe entire game, pretty much.PROSCan literally make a profit off of the cards as of writing this.10/10 would make three cents again.

Very simple game, but it's not bad for a dollar. It's a top-down perspective zombie shooting game, and it gets the job done, I suppose. If you like top-down games, then you might like this; however, it's not really my style.

Honestly, if you are a Transformers fan (or just a fan of third-person shooters, in general), you should get this game. Almost everything about it is great, although I hate the fact that there is no option for keybinding. Yes, really, there's isn't. There are different available layouts you can use, but they aren't great. Overall, this is a great game with fantastic gameplay and an emotional story, and the multiplayer is good. This is the sequel to War for Cybertron, but you don't really need to have played that game to understand this one, so that's a bonus.

Along with the regular campaign, the game provides a challenge mode to every level in the game which are even harder than the first by a landslide.When you're done with the game's provided campaign, the community challenges are just as fun, and even more challenging than the already hard levels. This is one of the best games out there right now, Episode 1 is free so why not give it a go? There's a reason 96% of people rate this game as overwhelmingly positive.- This game had its budget mostly spent on the writers and it shows, it spends time building the world and characters and you genuinely care about them, even when you think you wont. LiS throws some tough decisions at you periodically throughout each chapter which will leave you emotionally drained for days as you think of nothing but what you just done. - The soundtrack is just fantastic, they got the music spot on with the tone of the game, you'll feel you're in a trance by the end of each episode as it winds down with the distinct music while you reflect on everything that's happened.- There are some gaping holes in the logic but the story really drags you in that it doesn't really matter, you're not thinking about it. The lip syncing could have done with some more work but again, you never really find that it's a problem since you're so immersed in whats going on. - People in the negative reviews say that your choices don't matter but they do, they reflect how people perceive and react to you as you progress through the story making each playthrough different when you notice things you can do differently the this time around influencing how you finish the game.- People will also rag on the it being episodic but it wouldn't work in any other format, they definitely made the right decision as it breaks the game into 5 distinct chunks rather than drone on for 15-20 hours, you'll play one episode a day, lie down and not stop thinking about what just happened, its truly a game that sticks with you.

I would recommend the game, but here are the things that ruin it for me and can be easily fixed to improve the gameplay:  Respawning Very long respawn times on some servers - 15 seconds. Spawn points are very bad.  Often times, after waiting 15+ seconds to spawn, you will spend an additional 30 seconds walking to the front line.Sometimes, you will get there and just die in 5 seconds, so it gives a really bad feeling to the game sometimes. Weapon modes  Weapons have 2 modes to wield them. However, sometimes the alternative mode is to throw the weapon at the enemy and there is no way to know that, unless you remember for which weapon it happens.For some other weapons which are not thrown, there is no way to know in which weapon mode you are since the way it's held is obstructing the view or is being held in the wrong direction. Map Design Maps are very open which means that anyone can sneak up behind the front line and go all the way at the back, inside the castle or whatever defenses the map has.Usually, this means that the players with 1000+ hours will go back and kill people that have just spawned or are playing as an archer/crossbowman or whatever. Catapults Very high damage and big radius. Will insta kill everyone there but also your allies. Allies have friendly fire reduced to 1/4 of dmg but here it doesn't matter because the dmg is too big.Once you kill one of your teammates, these cancerous children will find you and team-attack you because they are feeling very angry. Horses Too easy to steer. To easy to move around. You will find horsemen chasing you through a building or something, navigating thin bridges and even across a single wooden plank.However, what is bad is once the horse has been stopped or slowed down, simply standing in front of it means it won't be able to move. At that point, it's very easy to kill the horseman.Lastly, there is a 5 second cooldown if you try to leave the map which can often times be too short to return and you die a very stupid death. The game doesn't calculate speed (or physics) You don't get speed bonus when hitting with additional speed. Things that I think are bad but might not be that easy to solve:  Weapon attack motion The weapon attack damage is the same no matter at which point you hit the enemy.This means that you can rotate your character to speed up or slow-down the attack. Also, it means that the person  can change targets mid attack and hit whoever is near just be moving their mouse very fast. Meanwhile, blocking has a cooldown, so the whole meta of this game is to manipulate the attack animation. Add the server pings and this makes deaths to feel very bad because often you die by being hit just at the end or just at the start of an animation, while the enemy hand is in a weird position. Also, often you see the enemy attacking, you press the block, the slow it down, your block expires, you get hit and die.

Really fun game if you enjoy hack and slash games.TL;DR: Really enjoyable game, if you like hack and slash games, you will definitely like this game.Pros:Gameplay:+ Gameplay is simply amazing if you get used with the controlls. High replay value and decently long story lines with quite a lot of characters.(It is so good I had organism when playing it. JK)Audio:+ Nice sound effects, voice acting and music.Game modes:+ Not as much as the other warriors series but enough considering the number of characters and the length of the story mode.(It has Story mode, Free mode and Survival mode. But free mode is literally the same as story mode except there is no character restrictions)Optimisation:+ It has a really good optimisation which even low spec pcs can run it. Really surprised me that it runs smoothly on highest settings even with these amount of enemies and big maps.Miscellaneous:+ Custom characters+ Multiplayer support+ Combat system+ Enemy AICons:Price:- Too high, buy it when it is on sales.(For a hack and slash game, this is too high. Even with many characters and long story line. ¬£40 is simply too much for a hack and slash game which is 80%+ similar to the rest of the series. I bought it when it is 50% off.)Graphics:~ It is alright, don't expect anything fancy.(Considering it needs to render many objects like enemies with decent AI, it is fair enough)Controlls:- Could be way better if they support mouse. (Controller is the best when it comes to playing this kind of games however you need to look at the community guide to make it work though. For me I am using keyboard to play and I am fine with it but just a little bit dizzy)

FIrst two hours in the game. Not a single event scares me. If you are really looking for a good horror game, I don't think this is really for you.I haven't finished the game yet so it is possible that I may change my thoughts.Pros:Nice graphics, considering it is from 2009Alright / a bit weird controlNice animationAt least it has a storyLow specs requirementCons:It can't deliver the horror elementFeels more like arcade shooter where the enemy can absorb up to 15 shotslinear / boring campaignnot-that-great map designrandom frame drop if you are unlucky.weird key-bindings FPS + Horror = can't deliver neither of it. (At least not working for this game)The list goes on and onSummary:Maybe it is alright in 2009 standard, but I do not think it worths ¬£10. You can spend ¬£10 on much better titles. This just doesn't deliver neither horror nor shooting elements. At least it doesn't work for me.

TL;DRIf you are looking for aim-and-shoot experience with sluggish movement and controls, this is for you. If you are looking for arcade fps experice, go play battlefield. If you are looking for singleplayer with realism experience, play something else.If you have bought this because of the reputation of realism of this game, bad luck.I heard this game is quite good, at least in the perspective of realism.However, what it really delivers is a really sluggish movement and control without any tutorials for which key to press and an arcade-ish combat experience. Movement and control:- Extremely weird and dumb key bindings- Really weird camera locking- Extremely small field of view. (Probably even smaller than horror games)- No options or what so ever for toggling. - Tutorials never tell you what key bindings for each action. Have fun searching in the option or googling it yourself.- Since spacebar is binded to standup and there is no option for jumping. You will frequently find yourself stuck between rocks.- The list goes on and on.Combat:- The enemy AI can spend all day long missing their shot even they are right next to you.- Hit-marker. Not great for a realism game in my opinion.- AIs can shoot at you even there are sh!t tons of trees and grass in front of you.- No option for adjusting the scope.- No way to tell how much is your bullet drop if everyone is firing. Good Luck- Your teammate is always dumb as hell+ Alright experience in long range combat. + There is bullet drop.+ Pretty nice voice actingTo be honest, if this is a indie game, it is pretty nice and alright. But if you say this is from a big studio, it is not that believable. Maybe because it is from 2009? The graphics is pretty nice considering the specs it needs.

Really like this game. Unlike other games, it didn't copy anything but invent their own battleline mode. There is absolutely no P2W in this game, only strategy and playing safely with your team.Sure you can spam the items if you have money, but doesn't mean you can beat everyone because there is a cooldown on it. On top of that, the items serve a utility purpose, not a spaming purpose. So you have money don't necessary mean you will have a BIG advantage.This is a mixture of rpg and WoT and some other tactical games. Give this game a shot and you will like it.

If you want to play free fps with no p2w, this maybe suit you. Otherwise don't bother.+ Not that much P2W+ Cool maps and graphics+ Skill required+ Nice auto-balance- Really weird Player movement control- Snipers are not that usefull in this game- Spawns are weird in capture mode- Can't access to settings in Tutorial mode- Generic Korea FPS- Actually, it feels more weird than other korea FPS- Well, is Nexon. So don't expect much.

TL:DR:Buy it if you like resource management, anime and Visual Novel.If you are like me that have never played resource management, don't buy it.If you have bought this game but unable to beat it and tried like 100 times?I suggest you use cheats, if there are any.Detail: Sorry, I love the game but it is just really frustrating even in the easiest settings. Here are the reasons why it is so annoying to play this game.1. Resource Management Gameplay: For me I have no idea this is a game that manage different kind of stuff. I thought this is just a typical VN game. I played in both normal mode and waifu mode (Easiest mode, it says you won't fail in this mode but I still got a bad end :/). It just feels like really repetitive and frustration simply because the difficulty is so hard in normal mode that I can't even survive through the first month. Also even you are in Waifu mode, clicking the same buttons over and over again is not that fun for a visual novel. :(2. No backlog: I personally think that backlog is really important for a VN game, especially when it is a PAID game. It is pretty annoying when you just misclicked once and skipped a dialog, this happens quite often and there is no way you can get back and read the conversation.3. Bugs: This is not a really big problem but sometimes the order of the events is messed up. For example in the Storage Room event, where the order of appology and explaination always changed everytime I load it.4. UI, really minor stuff but the UI doesn't look polished and clean.Short list for Good things about this game:+ Opening Songs+ Really lovely art + Professional music+ Reasonable Story Good for me is I bought this at sale so not a big deal, but for the people who bought it outside sales, bad luck.[Edit]After this post, I have found out the way to skip to different scenes. Although it is kind of annoying to do so, I will still probably do it because it is really fruastrating to start over again and the fact that I may get a bad end again. However, it is still really sad to me that I can't complete the game in a normal way, I really hope the dev can shorten the gameplay and also decrease the difficulty in the same time.

Havent play for a few months. Just went back to the game because this game is entering "Beta". Well, disappointed me as expected. For the people wonder why this game is so sh!t, the reason is not because of pay to win, there is no pay2win. The reason is this game is not fun anymore. What this game was:- Tactical battles- Really rely on how you build the bots- Chaotic battle (12 vs 12)- Type and CPU based matchmaking- Progressing into higher tier is so fun.- Choosing the parts you want to unlock as the game progress- No MOBA element whatsoever.- There is actual SKILL to learn.What this game is now:- Luck-based matchmaking because the dev want more impatiences players wanting for fast-pace gameplay.- No tactical battle whatsoever. Just try to rush to the capture points with your teammate and use some op weapons- The way of building your robot doesn't matter anymore. It will be destroyed within a split second anyway.- The only way to get into (12 vs 12) battle is to meet the "requirements" (Brawl mode) and the requirements changes every week.- Want to buy something you want? You need to click like 20 times to sell all your stuff and "forge" it. Because "CRATES"- They are trying to change this game into an arcade-moba game. OR you can just play LoL or Dota2.Summary:This game used to be so fun, used to play the game I could play forever. However, legend game up to Mega Bots update. I don't think FJ will read this or not but if you are, try to play this game and think is this game fun, skillful, and most importantly engaging anymore? Try to create some skills for this game and make it an actual Building game instead of trying to get more new players to play because chances are, they will leave anyway.TL;DR: This is game is not Robocraft anymore, is MobaCraft. There is no reason to play this game. If you love building, play MC or Crossout or other games. If you love Moba, play LoL or Dota2. That's it.

To achieve lifelong happiness,people say, you have to fall in love,I say pay ¬£10.99.If you've ever played a retro-classic, then you'll see just how much this game is like one.Shovel Knight is a brilliant portrayal of a classic with accurate, pixel-graphics and slid gameplay.As the blue burrower, Shovel Knight, you must travel to the Tower of Fate and defeat the Enchantress while beating any other rogue knights on the way.The gameplay is very entertaining; you can buy relics which can each help oyu in their own unique way.The bosses remind me of the classic megaman games with set patterns to memorize.The game if filled with secrets, cheats and achievements which gives it replay value.The soundtrack perfectly captures the retro style and you can listen to each and every track by collecting their music sheets throughout the world; two birds with one stone!I do recommend Shovel Knight; it has no flaws worth mentioning and can captivate your attention easily.Why not play?

Dust: An Elysian Tail is an astounding 2D metroidvania where you play as Dust who has lost his memories accompanied by Fidget, your small orange friend, and Ahrah a talking sword as you journey to find your purpose in this world.If anything, you need to play this for the story. As you journey throughout the world searching for your memories, you learn that you are more than you thought you were. Well-written and quite surprising if I had to say. Both comedic and dramatic with the help of Fidget! Really hoping for a sequel to continue the fantastic journey I had.The gameplay is firm; with the few melee moves and combos you are given at the start, you are expected to achieve over 1000 hit combos. Challenging yet not impossible with the help of Fidget! In addition, like most metroidvania, there are many collectibles in the form of armor, augments, pendants or even friends! The challenge is collecting them after succeeding in a parkour challenge or a challenge arena. On the other hand, this is the first 2d game where the roll ability changes your direction; caused a bit of confusion at the start.The animation and graphics are unique with a very distinctive art style which incorporates 3DCG with 2D art. They even put in the detail of having random weather conditions! Fantastic attention to detail. Although, the cutscenes... cutscenes aren't very appealing with the art style they used... In terms of music, the soundtrack created the mood and atmosphere perfectly. The voice acting couldn't have been executed better!All in all, a beautiful game with beautiful art, beautiful music and a beautiful story.Why not play?

First of all, I do not recommend buying this game.Instead, buy the definitive edition, Super Turbo Championship Edition, since it has everything and more!Guacamelee is a 2D luchadore metroidvania.It has tons of references to other games and media.The puzzles are consistently challenging by which you must utilise the abilities you currently have and would need to return to levels after gaining new abilities in search of treasure.The music is quite, quite, mexican-themed. This is a compliment.The graphics are outstanding; just the right amount of detail put in.There's also many post-ending activities such as the infernio challenges, achievement-hunting or collecting orbs (To get the happy ending).I do indeed recommend buying the STCE. This is an action-platformer you can't miss! Why not play?

I must live in a kitchen since the amount of onions that were cut whilst I was playing this game is unimaginable.Valiant Hearts is a 20% art, 30% soundtrack and 50% story game.The soundtrack is a main aspect. Most of it is piano solos but that sets the atmosphere perfectly. Puzzles incorporate sounds to give it the correct feel. The soundtrack is one of the reasons you should play. Gameplay is simple yet challenging and sustains originality in later levels.The other reason is the story. The story... Its like a Meunier M1916 shot you with a bullet full of emotions... but it doesn't draw blood... it draws tears...A perfect artstyle with a fantastique soundtrack and an incroyable story.Statistically, I would give this game a 7.5/10... but I am compeled to give this game a 10/10 because it deserves no less.Take this historical journey filled with hardships and struggles.Why not play?

Gunpoint is a 2-D platformer that is another stealth game where you can choose how you play (like a badass busting down doors or creeping on ceilings like a spider). What sets it apart from other games is its comedy aspect which comes into play with the client conversations that occur before and after missions. Another interseting feature about this game is the ridiculous amount of achievements; a lot of them you get while messing around but some you'll need to replay the game to get which makes starting a new game have purpose.The artstyle is good, the puzzles are good, what's not to like?Oh yeah.Its relatively short length (huhu).On the other hand, there are hundreds of workshop levels to play so you'll never get bored (but it does get a bit repetitive).Why not play?

Honestly might have been the pinnacle of the Total War series for me. Not even that the newer titles are bad, just that this is such a classic. They could have released this now and I would still buy it for full price and have fun.The unit roster isn't the largest or most diverse but overall everything just works well. Plus the art is great.

This game is an absolute masterpiece from visual design to voice acting and sound design. I absolutely suck and have only really played as advent so far and my only regret is that I don't have more time to spend on it to get better. It's a 4x real time strategy game that flows and ebbs with the thrill of tactical engagements, operational positioning and grand strategic decisions with the backdrop of real time construction, exploration and research along a faction specific tech tree. You can also tweak everything from ship movement, speed of research, win conditions and number of players to truly suit yourself as to whether you want to play a chill multi-hour game on a rainy day or micro intensive hour long click rush with friends.

I honestly have no idea how they packed so much stuff into one game. Like 100+ hrs in and I'm pretty sure I'm not even like a third of the way through the main questline. F*ck knows where my companion and that guy Irenicus have gone. Cowled who? Ya boi has already killed a dragon I met in a tavern, 2 beholders, a bunch of rakshashas and is currently busy trying to reseal some demon on the bottom floor of some 9 tiered murder house. The side quests don't even feel like side quests in the traditional sense with respect to DOSII and BGIII which have much more guided and linear storylines (even with their large areas to explore between parts). Like 1 hr in and having just left Irenicus' kink dungeon, I finally can go to the town gates to explore outside the city, but lo and behold during a quick stop in the tavern to rest, I discover a secret hole behind some random wall and get annihilated by some lich with timestop and immunity to all my spells, magical and normal weapons.This game is excellent and although clearly dated in some respects (e.g. graphics), it has managed to perfectly recreate the very essence of playing D&D with a group, with new quests and hooks every session and things to discover and delve into in even the most mundane of areas. High level gameplay is an added bonus. My only real gripe (admittedly mostly my own fault) is that I have only ever played 5e and 1e pathfinder so I'm not too familiar with the intricacies of AD&D such as calculation of saving throws and class levelling. Nonetheless, this hasn't stopped me from having a blast so definitely grab it when it's on sale.

Still remember my first few minutes in the game. I'd just barely learned how to shield myself and having opened it to the public, some rando with a wuxia robe joined and proceeded to destroy everything (us included) and carry us for the next 6 levels with combos so fast and convoluted that I had no idea wtf was going on. I'd like to think we formed an unspoken connection of mentor and student and after kicking him from my lobby, I hope that one day we will be brought together again so I can show him how good I've become at cheesing my way through the fights with just AoE death as fast as I can click.

Huge world map that really backs up title (Europe + North America + Indian subcontinent) which relies on you waging land campaigns but also establishing and defending naval trade routes/ferrying troops across oceans. Has really aged well especially since there aren't many other RTS games that cover this period. I wish my lower classes would stop clamouring for reform while I'm trying to expand my borders. Also, the artillery becomes obscenely destructive late game.

Great fun and decent humorous story. Essentially one of those basic clicker games where you just click areas on screen to interact with them, fiddle around to see if anything changes and try and solve a bunch of puzzles. Considering the Daedalic bundles are always like 80%+ sale would definitely recommend grabbing the series on cheap (like approx. ¬£10) and playing through. The art is also pretty nice and the game is well made. Overall a pretty chill series with some quirky and neat puzzles.

What is there to say. The graphics are dated, the gameplay isn't the deepest and gets pretty repetitive but at the same time I must be addicted to hacking sea raiders with my axe as I ride by.A certified hood classic so to speak.

Possibly the single most complete and polished package I have ever played. Offers endless replayability especially with the gift bag features and the Joyless Beginnings mod. Have already spent many hours getting destroyed by Mummie Dearest and the scarecrows and slipping on ice with my girlfriend.Is truly a game by which other similar entries should be judged. Having played BGII and this, I am greatly looking forward to playing BGIII in the future.

Brutal and dynamic gameplay. Coming from the original CoH and the DoW series, this game has really taken the best parts of the previous generation of entries and improved on them significantly while preserving the essence of the franchise. I was pleasantly surprised to find the factions intuitive and very similar to their CoH counterparts yet at the same time the huge range of doctrines provides a thematic and varied gameplay experience which really allows you develop to your own style.Whether you prefer bone crushing armoured spearheads, a blitz of infantry supported by aerial bombing runs or heavily fortified forward artillery bases, there is most definitely a permutation of doctrine and faction that will satisfy your inner history buff.In my 3rd ever game I ended up encircled on a central hill after the soviet horde had pushed my allies back through the forests on both sides. After weathering masses of T34/76s and SU-85s with a couple of manned AT guns and infantry with heavy losses from sustained 120mm mortar fire I managed to scavenge enough fuel to call a King Tiger to break the enemy lines behind, allowing me to recapture a vital point thus reconnecting my forward base and allowing me to reinforce my decimated squads. The match lasted another 30 mins by which point my vet 5 KT finally was knocked out right outside the enemy base during our final counteroffensive.10/10 would recommend if you're into that sort of stuff

Thoroughly recommend this game with some major pointers.1. This is best played as a single player game; however, multiplayer is enjoyable with some conditions.2. The DLC are ESSENTIAL to the full experience (I cannot repeat this enough) and only 1 player requires DLC for multiplayer.3. Games are long; 1-3 hrs (even when actively trying to expedite the experience).4. Very easy to learn.Prior to purchase I‚Äôd never heard of the original board game and it was gifted to me for multiplayer by another newcomer to the game. I‚Äôve never played online, and mostly play with the City, Dungeon, Highland, Woodland, Reaper, Sacred Pool and Deep Realms expansions enabled while also sometimes using the Cataclysm, Clockwork Kingdom, Frostmarch, Realm of Souls and Dragon expansions.Talisman is a highly strategic game revolving around probability while providing a dungeon crawling/ classic RPG adventuring atmosphere. Essentially, players take turns rolling a d6 to move either direction round a map, landing on spaces which cause various things to happen. This could be battling a monster, finding gear, or attaining new perks. All these experiences are condensed into a single deck you draw from, thus randomising encounters. The DLC add additions to the main map that you can travel around, each with their own decks of encounters. Other DLCs add cards to the pre-existing deck, increasing the range of encounters based around the same theme. Off of my own experience, much of the strategy involves mitigation and giving yourself more options in a game where almost everything is determined by the random outcome of a d6. Examples include replacing unfavourable encounters (Prophetess, Orb of Knowledge, Fez, Stompy), manipulating movement (Amazon, Trailblazer, Walking Stick, Dreadwing, Clockwork Owl, Teleport, Poltergeist), rerolling dice (Lucky, Fang, Token of Fate, destinies, evil characters with high starting fate), manipulating battles (Martyr, Soul Shatter, Bounty Hunter), spellcasting (generally gives you things to do during your turn)  and ultimately protecting yourself from things that can really screw you (Lugh's Cloak, Bag of Holding, Counterspell, Lucky Coin, Nuadu's Torc, going for less risky plays). In addition, certain things can carry over after death (dragon scales, destinies, quest rewards) meaning that you can plan even in that respect.The sheer number of possibilities (with the DLC) means that many long term and spur of the moment combos are possible and yet every space, card and character is clearly explained when you land on or draw it meaning that even the newest of players can play within a few minutes. The automation of gameplay also makes it more accessible and is well done although the casting windows and queuing of spells requires a bit of getting used to. Whenever I have thought that something is not working, it is usually because I have not read the card carefully and I am genuinely not able to use it for some reason. Sometimes this specific wording means that certain objects are far more powerful than they first appear (e.g. Arnkell, Lucky Coin).There is far too much to cover everything else, but I will attempt to briefly address my original pointers together with pros and cons frequently brought up by other reviewers.Cons often brought up (incl. in the Metacritic reviews)1.	Randomness ‚Ä?as stated before, I do believe that there is strategy involved with fiddling probability. For example, the prophetess‚Ä?ability allows me to replace encounters but ultimately the player chooses how much they want to push their luck. Also, many combos/plays only require 2 or even 1 card. Finally, knowledge of the differences in regions of the map can allow you to farm in areas which are more suited for your character like choosing to focus on encountering red scales as a high strength character. 2.	Unbalanced characters ‚Ä?there is no doubt that this is true. To counterbalance, I enjoy having players choose from 3 random characters and then reselecting if they die. This feels like it balances things out and makes it more fun with both AI and human players - you don‚Äôt feel stuck with a bad character and equally stronger ones can be killed. I would like to note that while spellcasting characters are strong, I don‚Äôt find them to be horrifically broken when you have selected more DLC. With all the extra spells added, I find that their spellcasting ability becomes more balanced and muted with cycling also being less effective.3.	Games take too long ‚Ä?completely agree with this. I usually play against AI and keep jumping to the next human unless I want to queue a spell or do something else. Via this method, I don‚Äôt think this negatively affects gameplay. However of course this can‚Äôt be done in multiplayer and hence why I find this game is most enjoyable in single player when and if you‚Äôre playing purely for the strategy aspect. If you do play multiplayer, I would certainly recommend capping the turns or choosing a faster ending, especially if not all players will be available for a 3-hour game. 4.	Season pass doesn‚Äôt include newer all DLC as promised/game is expensive especially as you need the DLC ‚Ä?As I got the game quite recently this issue was a bit before my time. As a result, I can understand why other people are frustrated, but from my own perspective and also addressing the second part about price, grabbing all DLC and the base game while on a minor sale for around ¬£30 seemed reasonable which I assume most people would do. I wouldn‚Äôt get the DLC for the regular price. 5.	AI get better rolls ‚Ä?maybe but if true is very subtle. At the same time, it could be me only noticing the times I really get screwed over whereas I never notice when other players/the AI get screwed. 6.	AI is bad ‚Ä?The AI will inevitably have a disadvantage no matter what they do. On the other hand, the AI does seem to optimise for the most part and if you want to make it more of a challenge you can always play against more at once or give them better characters.7.	Clunky UI ‚ÄìThe majority of things are clearly explained especially with regards to space and card effects and options are shown clearly, both during your turn and other people‚Äôs turns. That said, some things are unintuitive, like spell casting timings. Any newcomers could be at quite a disadvantage here against the AI or more experienced players, and easily may not realise solutions without outside help.8.	Not much replayability once you‚Äôve seen all the cards several times ‚Ä?I‚Äôd disagree with this since you can play so may characters and swap out so many DLC. In addition, that knowledge of the array of cards that appear in certain areas is essential to planning out your strategy as you get better. Again, though, this is quite dependant on buying the DLCs. With just the base game the cards and scenarios will feel repetitive.9.	Unsocial compared to the board game ‚Ä?Subjective, to a large extent I agree that much of the idle banter you get between players while it isn‚Äôt their turn is lost. It feels like a much longer gap between turns sitting in front of a screen. This is one of the reasons I feel that it is better as a single player game. Might work for some not for others.10.	Bugs/crashes ‚Ä?the only crash I have experienced is where the game freezes, but this doesn‚Äôt happen too often, and the game automatically saves for me. It‚Äôs so fast to close and reopen that I usually don‚Äôt mind, though it is an inconvenience.Overall:From my perspective the digital version has offered me a taste of what so many love about the original cult classic at a FRACTION of the price while also providing me with hours of single player fun. It is an easy way to become familiar with the rules, strategies and try out the expansions before you get the real base game for ¬£30 (not including the expansions which are ¬£10 each). I would certainly consider this game a good port and a great entry for the physical game.

Risen 3 ist ein muss f√ºr jeden Risen/Gothic Fan. Es ist durch und durch ein PB-Spiel, mit all seinen St√§rken und der ein oder anderen Schw√§che. Die Freiheit alles zu tun ist Segen und Fluch zugleich, denn leider ist der rote Faden nicht unbedingt erkennbar. Was die Mainstory anbelangt, weiss ich nach 10 Stunden nicht genau, was ich eigentlich zu tun habe. Es ist ein bisschen wie in "Gothic 2 die Nacht des Raben": Man kann die Chronologie der Ereignisse schnell durch einander bringen. (Ich werde weiter unten meine pers√∂nliche Einsch√§tzung zur Spielchronologie erw√§hnen.)Das Risen 3 trotzdem mit jeder Minute mehr fesselt, liegt an seinen wundersch√∂nen (trotz 8 Jahre alter Engine) und abwechslungsreichen Umgebungen und vorallem an seiner unglaublich dichten Atmosph√§re. √úberall gibt es etwas zu entdecken!!! Es kommen viele NPCs aus den Vorg√§ngern vor, jedoch entwickelt man bei weitem keine so starken Bindungen wie z.b. in einem Mass Effect. Die Beziehungen sind meist "zweckm√§ssig", sch√∂n aber das es jetzt Begleiterquests gibt, die ein wenig mehr bieten als nur ein kratzen an der Charakteroberfl√§che des NPCs.Das Charaktersystem ist schnell verst√§ndlich und bietet viel Freiraum und Individualisierungsm√∂glichkeiten. Dazu kommt eine akkute Goldknappheit, die genaue Planung und √úberlegung der Talente f√∂rdert, wunderbar :DAlles in allem nochmal eine klare Empfehlung an Risen/Gothic-Fans. Wer jedoch die Vorg√§nger nicht gespielt hat, kann mit vielen Charakteren wahrscheinlich wenig anfangen und wird sich vermutlich verloren vorkommen in dieser gro√üartigen, freien Spielwelt :DNoch einige Tipps:- Lernt sobald es geht "Gegenangriff" (ben√∂tigt 1000 Gold, Nahkampf 40, H√§rte 20)- redet unbedingt mit Bones, nach dem Verlassen der Krabbeninsel...er hat einige Quests am Start, die nicht unwichtig f√ºr die Chronologie sind.- redet generell immer mit neuen Mitglieder eurer Crew f√ºr weitere Quests- meine pers√∂nliche Chronologie der Inselanfahrten (Vorausgesetzt ihr wollt alle Fraktionen bis zur Beitrittsentscheidung spielen):* Antigua* Takarigua* Kila (bis zur Beitrittsentscheidung: Voodoopirat)* Taranis / Calador (bis zur Beitrittsentscheidung: Magierw√§chter/D√§monenj√§ger)* Calador / Taranis (bis zur Beitrittsentscheidung: D√§monenj√§ger/Magierw√§chter)* F√ºr eine Fraktion entscheiden* Die DLC Inseln besuchen

Early impressions after 15+ hours, game is good. I have had no crashes or graphics performance issues as others have complained of. My system is i9-10850k with EVGA 3080. I am able to achieve 60FPS on the highest quality settings with HDR at 1440p.In areas that are stormy (mist in the air, etc) frame rate may drop to 45FPS for a fraction of a second, but this has been a non-issue for me. Quite literally it sits at 60FPS 99.999% of the time.---One big complaint, there is no official support for ultrawide resolution. I am really not happy about this. I think it is inexcusable.

Sweet graphics, tight controls, challenging and rewarding. Solid weapons and bloody chunks of flesh everywhere. One of the best platformers I've played in many years. The game forces you to get better...play on, and you will. Like all great platformers, Valfaris beckons you to come back from death and try again.One letdown for me...the soundtrack is sub-par. Old-school platformers had much better soundtracks than this. Where they hit on graphics, the soundtrack is a bust.

I've played a lot of baseball in my life and I've played a lot of video games. I've also played this game a lot. Trust me, the longer you play it, the more you discover it really is just trash. Never ending pop-ups to the catcher...so many other things just as improbable and every bit as irritating. So, for SMB2, the devs claim to have addressed some of the issues like the ridiculous number of pop-ups to the catcher, but they add PROCs that include player injuries? Neither is desirable as an actual feature of the game. It's like replacing one thing with something that is equivalent, but then for SMB2 they want $30. Okay, apparently the devs need some clarity, so listen and get this straight. Your game essentially fills the role of an arcade baseball game. It has some sim elements that actually add to the game, but basically just seasons and some elements of team development. SMB1 the team development is a horrible grind. I should get SMB2 for free after SMB1 garbage. Your game fills the arcade baseball genre roll, and the only reason it has enjoyed any success is because there simply lacks a decent game to fill it's place.The devs want a somewhat realisitic physics-based experience, realisitic baseball, horrible interface, attempt to add in too many sim elements...ultimately the game is junk. I've felt this way and essentially hated the game the entire time I've played it. I'm writing a review now because I hear what they claim to have improved in the new version and there is no way in hell it's worth $30. Devs either need to learn more about baseball or more about how to make an enjoyable game that doesn't try to [awkardly] fit in multiple genres. My assumption, you sat the bench in little league and cried on the way home like the stupid animations in this game. How in the hell can you have pitchers throwing 100+mph and think it's reasonable to have crying animation? Do you know how annoying that ‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô• is? I imagine you all were bullied by small children when you were 18 years old.I'll buy SMB2 in a bundle and they get their 50 cent cut, otherwise no.

Northgard is a very pleasant and enjoyable game. A bit of Sid Meier's Civ and Banished meshed together, set in a Norse mythology atmosphere of sorts.There is room for improvement, but with 50 hours of playtime under my belt, I would say that I still have quite a bit of work to master the strengths of each clan and how to successfully win in each possible way.From the outset, it seems that Wisdom and Trade victories are a bit "overpowered" (perhaps a bit unbalanced). I can't say this with certainty until I have more hours played. Depending on the clan you choose, there are different approaches. To truly evaluate the game, many playthroughs are necessary.Despite this, it is my impression that there is a slight lack of balance, and possibly a lack of depth. This will not likely deter you from playing many hours, and I believe improvements will be coming along nicely while in early access.One point to mention; I would hope to see a more gradual transition going into and out of winter. It isn't a terrible issue, but one that I would prefer to be improved upon. Tl;drGreat game, particularly while still in early access. Pleasant graphics, relaxing game, can be easy or reasonably challenging in single-player. I have not tried multiplayer yet. I see potential for very many hours of play.

It's been more than three years since I last played Endless Space. Seeing that it's on sale this weekend makes me remember how much I really wanted to like this game. You hear people say that a lot about games...no ‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•, eh? Bought it, of course you want to like it.Skip the blah and straight to the TLDR summary;Endless Space is boring and disappointing. Though somewhat challenging, it's dull and doesn't do enough to hold my interest. End result...to live up to the challenge, I'd be doing so only for the achievements or just out of complete hardheadedness. There are plenty of better games to play, and most of us have friends and/or family that deserve more of our time than this.

Artillerists is like a really bad, unbalanced version of the old boardgame Battleship, which has been re-created as a video game quite a few times and much better than this.This is a complete guessing game, at least to the extent that I have played it. You can earn money to spend in an upgrade shop (the Artillery, where you buy "abilities"), but you have to grind out guessing games to earn the money. Whereas this is obviously a Battleship style game (obvious even before you purchase the game), what you don't know ahead of time is how unbalanced it is. By the third mission of the main campaign, you have 2 mortars in a 6x6 grid. The mortars take up one block each, so you can only take 2 hits and then you lose. The AI has more than 6 blocks of units in a 6x6 grid, and the game gives you no idea how many the AI has at the beginning of each mission. I haven't made it past the third mission of the main campaign (as of this review) because this is just a pitiful waste of my time when I could be watching paint dry instead.The AI also has "abilities" to hit multiple blocks, whereas you are stuck with grinding to buy lesser abilities early in the game, and they are really expensive and underpowered, particularly when the AI has some ‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô• that can hit like 5 blocks at once as well as at least one airstrike (which hits 2 blocks) by this third mission. You can use radar and airstrike abilities if you have purchased them at this point, but they are very expensive. When I say expensive I mean you will grind out clicking on grids trying to win missions in order to gain money. There are side-missions in which you can gain money, but the clicking and guessing is just horribly boring. In the game Battleship it's essentially the same, except you know what you're up against (the same units as you have, and there is a little more fun to the minimal planning and some strategy involved even though it amounts to guessing).This is just a poorly thought out game. Nobody likes an unbalanced guessing-game. There are people that pop up with irritating dialog as well, which just makes it even more annoying because that makes more clicks to grind out. Count this as an extremely negative review. HUGE thumbs down!

At the time of this review, I have played Tank Blast for less than 30 minutes. The objective of the game is very simple; destroy enemy tanks and don't die. The concept is simple, but the game presents a reasonable challenge. The AI is a quite accurate shot, and you must be as well in order to succeed. In terms of graphics, textures are very plain. Shading is nice and, together, this enhances the tight, solid feel of the game. Very nice particle effects and pounding explosions seem to justify the otherwise simplistic appearance. The contrast is satisfying. Controls are pretty good and feel tight as well. Currently there is no controller support and no multiplayer game mode. Though a nice game otherwise, lack of these features may be a significant drawback to many players.

I purchased New Kind of Adventure as part of a game bundle in December 2015. As such, it was extremely inexpensive, and that is fortunate. The game is inexpensive even at full price, but that is almost its only redeeming quality. I will also say that it is quite colorful, but the game is so bad that I could only play for about 5 minutes. The controls are very bad and there appears to be nothing that you can actually do. If you attempt to travel much beyond where you begin, you get a message stating "this area is unavailable in Alpha", which is akin to the "under construction" message occasionally encountered on websites. This is a recipe for almost certain failure. Upon attempting to exit the game, I could only do so by forcing with Ctrl+Alt+Del.The developer (Mint Age Studios) has stated:Originally posted by Mint Age Studios:"I tried to finish the new update in few months but I couldnt because the budget was very low and revenue from Steam was barely enough to get food."After some explanation stating attempts to "find investor and hire people" had failed, a plug for a new game was presented, stating:Originally posted by Mint Age Studios:"My next step is to make a small game, launch it next month and invest money in development.I am looking for testers and supporters for this new game. Its name is Black Prince..."It is unacceptable to expect financial support from consumers for multiple games which can barely claim to be in Alpha access. I will idle for the trading cards, but that is all I will return for.

Very good game in terms of design, but performance is worse than average for this genre. Game should explain its systems (mainly stealth and reputation) better because they're not always that realistic/expected.Some notes for the developers that I hope they'll address in sequel/future:  - Unnecessary clutter collisions where horse get stuck on small height deltas (e.g. stones, knee high fences). - Looted arrows not stacking properly (workaround: move arrows to horse and back to player inventory). - NPCs still detecting you when you're behind. They appear to have a hidden "detection gauge" but it isn't indicated in any way. - Reputation seems to decrease after you sleep, even if no one saw you commit a crime from before. - NPC chatter spam repeating the same lines over and over. - Combat is very RNG where "stronger" enemies just counter or dodge your attacks about 70% of the time. - Slow-mo in melee combat happens too often and just looks weird/off-key. - No indication of when timed quests will fail in the journal. If you start another quest that keeps you for multiple days you can fail others and have to revert to an older save or miss out (there is no NG+).I rate it a 7/10, would easily be a 9/10 if these annoyances were fixed

Driving is nice with a great landscape and atmosphere but clearing the tasks in an area are repetitive. The combat isn't varied and the sluggish player animations made it extra tedious to navigate through. Game has audio stuttering which can be distracting.5/10
Wonderful game with a slow build up that might not hook you immediately.

+ Mission diversity (not just timed/alarm missions)+ Lots of vehicles+ Lots of tools/items+ Difficulty settings+ Mod support- No option for enabling (more) complex structural integrity; Destruction is simpler than shown on twitter during early development. As is, buildings float when not fully detached from world- Ground is not destructible (even if it was limited, would be nice to have)- No diving in water- Vehicles break down due to small collisions while driving with cargo (mainly with trucks, which have weak containers). Attaching cargo with planks does not prevent damage if cargo is too close to interior walls.- Building bridges with planks is cumbersome due to planks sometimes phasing into each other when spawning them- Leaning on single thread physics limits this game's potential enormouslySo far, in early access, it's a 8/10 game

This game's engine sucks but the gameplay is amazing and extremely well balanced. Do not look up location of weapons if you want a challenge. Recommend getting but you need a high end PC and even then, expect lots of stuttering in some situations, partly due to shader compilation and unoptimized world streaming. Once shaders are cached it's much more playable.Use flawless widescreen[www.flawlesswidescreen.org] and make sure Easy Anti Cheat is not loaded while using it to fix: - Not supporting widescreen by clumsy black bars implementation which still renders the game world behind it.. - 60 FPS locked

What's good: - Combat fluidity and skill variety - Story, its cutscenes are grand and animations are excellentWhat's meh: - Puzzles weren't interesting and most of it felt like filler - Fast travel "exists" but only one area is available at any time until you complete main story. You can only fast travel from specific locations. - Travel is a bit slow with lots of climbing. For a god he's a pretty slow climber.. - Pickup popups are tedious after the 5th time - No FOV option. Increasing FOV breaks some cutscene animations (or story surprises that are prepared "off-screen") - I had the "LUCK" stat build but didn't get enough resources to craft a single armor piece during main story. LUCK stat on armor is also rare. - Inverted mouse acceleration. Moving the mouse quickly slows the camera turn down. Though I could get used to it. - Quick time events (QTE) sections were a bit long in some fights.I give this game a 8/10
